loans.name: Xiomara Francisca

texts.es: Xiomara tiene cuatro hijos, dos de sus hijos  estudian en la escuela comunitaria, dice que ella  quiere que sus hijos estudien para que se defiendan en la vida . su esposo y ella se dedican a la agricultura siembran granos básicos y café de lo que recogen de la cosecha lo venden y otra parte la dejan para consumo de la casa .  en la comunidad de nombre el venado que es donde habitan luz eléctrica no hay pues están bien retirados entonces por las noches lo que usan es candelas pero desean ya tener luz en en su hogar ya que el uso de candelas es peligroso por algún incendio o que los niños se quemen es por eso que desea un préstamo para mejorar la condición de vida de todos los integrantes de su familia en especial la de sus pequeños hijos
texts.en: Xiomara has four children. Two of her children go to the community school. She says that she wants her children to go to school so that they can define themselves in life. She and her husband work in agriculture. They plant basic grains and coffee. They sell part of what they harvest and keep the rest for household consumption. The community where they live, called El Venado, doesn't have electricity because it is very remote. At night, they use candles, but they want electricity in their home, because using candles is dangerous because if there were a fire, they children could get burned. That is why she wants the loan to improve the whole family's quality of life, especially that of her young children.

loans.use: to by a solar panel system.

loans.name: Zymratkan

texts.ru: Зымраткан 29 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2008 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле обувью, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Зымраткан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Зымраткан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом - на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Зымраткан планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Zymratkan is 29 years. Together with her husband they are raising two children (one daughter, one son). In 2008, the couple started the business in footwear trading, using as start-up capital an amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  They managed to develop their business and establish regular customers, and now Zymratkan has an average income of 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further improve and expand their businesses, Zymratkan reached out to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to increase in the inventory of her goods.  Zymratkan plans to invest the income proceeds from the loan in the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale for retail

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is a 52-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money through running a business selling vegetarian food for people in her community.

Sang would like a loan to purchase better quality ingredients and rice to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and rice to make food to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, mangoes and other fruits. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas and mangoes. 

Her business goal is to have a large business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas and mangoes

loans.name: Katuki

texts.en: Katuki is a 63-year-old woman. She has 2 children aged 27 and 30. She describes herself as disciplined and goal-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are individual customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as transportation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables and charcoal. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more vegetables and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more fish, oranges, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 40-year-old single woman. She has 2 children aged 4 and 9 years old. She describes herself as ready to serve her customers well. 

She operates a retail business where she sells maize and beans, and she has been involved in this for 10 years. Her business is located in an open market and her primary customers are local people. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and beans. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and beans

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en: Jecinter is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 3 and 6. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair and beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as power outages. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a hair dryer to use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 45, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. Mai earns money through her business producing traditional turbans for brides and grooms. She started this business over 14 years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to make turbans and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materals to make wedding turbans for brides and grooms

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam, 57, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including a daughter and his wife. He works in a mechanical shop. His wife has been selling sea weed cakes. 

Tam has worked in this field for 24 years. He would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of steel and equipment to increase his production to meet his customers' needs. He also hopes his business will ensure that his family members have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy steel and equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her son. Hue earns money through her business producing pillow cases, sheets, and blankets. She started this business six years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of materials to make bedding linen to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials for making bedding linen

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Douglas is a married man. He has 7 children. He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes and coconuts. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His primary customers are individuals. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more potatoes, coconuts and vegetables. His business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open another business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, coconuts and vegetables.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a married man. He describes himself to be humble and God-fearing. He operates a fruit stand where he sells apples. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. 

Johana describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of apples to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his fourth  loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were  repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of apples to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene is 40 years old  and is married with two kids. Mylene is a very hardworking and a person of faith. She has been managing a hog raising business for eight years. She is asking a loan amounting Php 25,000 to buy vitamins and feed for her business. She hopes for a loan so that she can expand her business to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be passionate and persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells water and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are reliable. 

Lozi describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock and lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks and drinking water  to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks and drinking water to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined and effective. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular ones.

Agnes describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros lives in a residential area with her husband and children. Along with her husband, she has started a project in order to increase the family's income and get ahead in life: raising pigs. She works every day, and has the advantage of raising her animals on the property of her own home. 

The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy feed for the pigs. She will also use some of the money to make improvements to the area in which she raises the animals. She hopes to be able to take better care of the animals in order to sell them for a higher price and improve her earnings. 

For Milagros, it is very important to grow the business so that she can make a good living and repay the loan on time. She will be able to improve the standard of living of her family, and give her children a better education so that they will have better opportunities in the workforce.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperaza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Josefa is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 (Christ is the Hope). She lives with her long-term partner and their four children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in La Romana. The community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers where she, her family, and the other 14 female micro-entrepreneurs in this group reside. Josefa has been taking out loans with Esperanza for about four years and she is excited to receive her eighth loan from Esperanza, as each previous loan helped her to improve her business. 

Josefa says that her most important goals are to have her own house in the main city and to raise, educate, and support her children. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall, from which she sells goods her customers use to make their daily food. Normally she sells to her neighbors. She plans to use her portion of this loan to invest in her business by buying goods to resell, including vegetables, fruits, meats, and charcoal. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for December sales. Josefa thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, meats, charcoal and other items.

loans.name: Unidad Y Progreso 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Javier is the coordinator of his group, Unidad y Progreso (Unity and Progress) 1 & 2. His group is located in a rural area of Santiago. Javier makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner. For the past two years, he has sold silver jewelry. Javier says that his dream is to have a successful business, and thanks to his loan and the profits he is savings, he will plan to accomplish his dream shortly. 

Javier is requesting his first loan with Esperanza to buy jewelry for men and women made from silver, stainless steel, and other materials. He will use the future profits from his loan to reinvest in his business and increase his sales and inventory. Javier thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy jewelry for men and women

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is a 40-year-old woman with three children whom she supports. This is her fifteenth loan, this time for Php 11,000.  She has a retail shop, and her business is located at Bayabo. She has had this business for eight years and she earns a monthly income of Php 2,000.
Cristeta is planning to use the loan to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, flour, candies and spices.

loans.name: Jecelyn

texts.en:
Jecelyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Jecelyn requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mhelanie

texts.en:
Mhelanie is 26 years old, and she is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mhelanie requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish and plastic bags for her business.

Mhelanie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Mhelanie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and plastic bags for her business

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Zenda has been in this business for 6 years. Zenda earns more income from manicures and pedicures.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor works hard to support her family. Flor is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Flor has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Flor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Unidad Y Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Unidad y Progreso (Unity and Progress) 3. Her group is located in a rural area of Santiago. Ana makes her home there in a simple structure and is a single mom with a child. For almost two years, she has operated a retail store. Ana says that her dream is to become a professional and she wants to finish her college studies.

Ana is requesting her second loan with Esperanza to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Ana will use her future profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her child. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and accessories

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Munkhzul is 36 years old, married, and has children. She lives in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been selling cosmetics by renting a stall at a trade center. Her husband has a position as a senior security officer at a bank. 

Munkhzul is requesting a loan for $1,400, which she will use  to buy bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam for a house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned resulting in less pollutants being released into the air. According to the state research institution, the main source of air pollution in Mongolia is excessive burning of coal in slums.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 4, 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Gerta is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 4, 5, 6 & 7 (Christ is the hope). She has three children and she lives together with her long-term partner, in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers. 

Gerta says that her most important challenge is to have her own house and to raise her children in a safe home and support all their needs. She operates a food stall, where she sells meat. It runs like a fried food stall as well as a butcher shop, as she can sell the meat cooked, mostly for dinner. She also sells other goods for daily meals. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy more different meats and some vegetables and fruit. 

Gerta is excited to receive her seventh loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Gerta thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: To buy pork, chicken, and beef

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lowela works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lowela is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lowela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon (in the photo) is single and lives with her nephew in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her nephew is a sewing machine repairman.

Yon is a teacher. In addition, she operates a tailoring business at home and when farming season comes, she also grows rice, beans, and sesame, with her nephew's help. 

Yon wants to buy another type of sewing machine which can be better for her to work with in her tailoring business. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is married with five children, and she operates a general store to make a living. In addition to this, her husband works as a driver and earns extra income. For three years in running the store, she has earned well to support the needs of her family and has been able to sustain it. Though her children are already settled down with their own families, she still has time with them and sometimes supports some of their needs. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 30 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Juvilyn has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Consolacion works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school, Amorlina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell.

Amorlina has been in this business for five years. In the future Amorlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children ages five and 10. In 2009, Aminata established a business selling cooking utensils, rubber products, and cutlery. She began her business to be self-reliant and help her husband with the children’s education. Aminata’s business is located at the city center and her main customers are adults. She works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and earns about 1,750,470 SLL each month. 

Aminata is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy pots, pans, cutlery, and plastic cups and spoons. She has successfully repaid two previous loans. Aminata hopes that her loan will improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, she plans to expand her business out of town. Aminata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pots, pans, cutlery, and plastic cups and spoons

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 53 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sardines, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Dina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 32 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like soap, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Azenith has been in this business for four years.

In the future Azenith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase item like soap, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to conduct lab test batches for nutrition information, as well as pay for insurance and a new website

loans.name: Banco Mujer Santa Marta Group

texts.en:
Rosibel is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Currently she lives with her children and her husband. Two of her kids are in primary school and the other is in high school. Rosibel’s husband is self-employed and works on a small farm in a rural community which is where the family lives. She is an organized, nice, and humble woman who not only wants to grow her business but to also to grow on a personal level. Rosibel’s principal line of work is door-to-door sales of catalog merchandise but she also has experience raising animals such as chickens, pigs, and cattle. For many years, she has been committed to door-to-door sales to help her husband. Due to the income that Rosbel has generated from her sales, she has been able to assist her children with school expenses and contribute a little to the home expenses. Thanks the Fundación she has extended the reach of her business and achieved personal growth. Rosibel believes that she can grow even more and improve the quality of life of her and her family.  

Rosibel is requesting a loan to invest in more catalog merchandise. Along with her four group loan partners, her group will invest in the materials needed to start a beauty salon and purchase cattle. This loan will help Rosibel and her partners grow both personally and professionally.

loans.use: to purchase catalog merchandise to sell

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is aged 50 years and widowed. She is a mother of four children. To make a living, she and her husband sold grocery items and sometimes she works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 30 years, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Neang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Neang is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to expand her business to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Sokhorn is a 52-year-old, widowed mother of three children. The main source of her family’s income is from selling snacks. Having been in this business for five years, she is able to earn about KHR 40,000 per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Sokhorn’s Group of four members, who are all female. Now, Sokhorn is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

As the leader, Sokhorn is going to use her portion to buy a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have good health by using this latrine.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 50 ans, et 7 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Baba, commune de Baba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de poisson fumé, et d’ustensile. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente SOROFE  la personne assise n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson fumé. Elle compte acheter 1 gros panier de poisson fumé chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, chez elle, et au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group consists of married women who average 50 years of age and seven children each. They all live in traditional families in the village and commune of Baba, in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as friends and neighbors, and through ties of kinship. 

They sell cereals, smoked fish and utensils. To meet their massive customer demand, they turned to the microfinance institution SORO YIRIWASO. This is their 4th group loan cycle.

SOROFE is the group member seen sitting in the photo. She is a reseller of smoked fish. She never received any formal education. She plans to buy one large basket of smoked fish from wholesalers in Massigui. She retails her merchandise to a mixed clientele for cash, from her home and at the local market. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover her family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda  has been operating her own retail store for more than four years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Having a big family calls for more efforts to provide the necessities, specially to her five children. The couple has to work hard with determination of having better income to provide their children better education than they have. 

To improve sales, Imelda took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Emily is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, rice, sugar, spices, etc. to sell.  Felisa has been in this business for four years now.  In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, rice, sugar, spices, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district of Kampong Cham province, Thida is 27 years old and married with one child. To make a living, she has been working as a garment worker while her husband is a paid construction worker. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Thida is on her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Thida is going to use her portion to build a proper latrine for her family to use. She hopes to have a clean latrine so as to make her family's life better.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Eng is 33 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. They earn a living through farming rice; sometimes she works for others for a fee. They have been in this business for seven years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 23,000 KHR per day to support her family. 
This is the first loan for Eng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Eng is going to use her portion to build a latrine. She hopes to keep her family members healthy and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora y amable, acompañada, tiene 47 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son varones de 27 y 22 años de edad respectivamente, el mayor se encuentra estudiando su carretera técnica de Cuarto Frio en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas y el menor estudia su carrera universitaria en Managua y una mujer de 24 años, independiente. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para reconstruir su vivienda de madera que desde hace aproximadamente 7 años, no le realiza mejoras, para comprar 200 pies de madera, 200 bloques, un quintal de hierro y cemento para y construir el baño de concreto (cemento). Con el primer financiamiento que le otorgo PANA PANA lo utilizo para comprarle laptop a su hijo de 22 años que se encuentra estudiando Electricidad Industrial en una universidad de Managua. Su sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudies y que el mayor siga los pasos de su hermano menor que estudie una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
She is a courageous and friendly woman. She is 47 years old and has 3 children, 2 sons aged 27 and 22. The eldest is studying a technical degree in refrigerated storage room in the town of Puerto Cabezas, and the youngest is studying at university in Managua. Her daughter is 24 years old and is independent. 

She is requesting her third loan to rebuild her wooden house, which she hasn’t made repairs to in about 7 years. The loan is to purchase 200 feet of wood, 200 blocks, a quintal (220 lbs.) of iron and cement to build a bathroom of cement. With the first loan she received from PANA PANA she used to purchase a laptop for her 22-year-old son who is studying Industrial Electricity at the university in Managua. 

Her dream is for her children to finish their studies and that the eldest follows his younger brother and goes to university.

loans.use: to rebuild her wooden house, which she hasn’t made repairs to in about 7 years. To purchase 200 feet of wood, 200 blocks, a quintal (220 lbs.) of iron and cement to build a bathroom of cement.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando is 42 years old and chose  to remain single. He lives in a rural community, planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. He aims to earn and save more income to support his elderly parents and to save for his future. He plans to expand his plantation but he has limited capital, and for this reason,he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in planting vegetables. He hopes that his request will be granted so he will be able to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is 61 years old and a married mother of nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicitas has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing. Felicitas has been in this business for three years. In the future, Felicitas would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 54 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by growing vegetables in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings like eggplants, ampalaya (bitter melons), etc.. She has been growing vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings like eggplants, ampalaya (bitter melons), etc.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap is 42 years old, married, and she has four children. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been in farming rice and fishing. Having been in this business for 15 years, she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to support her family’s need.  Pheap’s group consists of three members who are all female.  She has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields, and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Altyn

texts.ru: Алтын 65 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 9 детей. У Алтын - высшее образование, окончила университет, по специальности -историк. Трудовую деятельность начала в средней школе, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать, на данный момент на пенсии. По характеру Алтын очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Алтын занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алтын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алтын обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки овец, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Алтын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения внуков в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en:
Altyn is 65 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up nine children. Altyn has a higher education and graduated from a university with a specialty as a historian. Her work activities began in high school, then she got married, but continued to work, and currently she is retired. By character, Altyn is very responsible, outgoing, and cheerful. Together with her husband, Altyn raises livestock and crops, having begun 11 years ago with a livestock purchase of 50,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Altyn currently has on her farm: two dairy cows, one horse, and 20 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, and also works 2.0 hectares of land, where she main grows beans. The crop is sold to wholesalers.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Altyn applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase sheep for expanding her livestock count. After purchasing the sheep, they will be located on their own farm. In the summer, livestock will be under the care of a shepherd.

Altyn plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the number of domestic animals, and plans to save money to pay tuition for her grandson in higher education establishments.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Herminia to improve her business. She has a second-hand clothing business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, trousers, shorts, bags, long-sleeved and  short-sleeved clothing. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Herminia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, bags, long-sleeved and  short-sleeved clothing

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: A rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Savuth is 55 years old and married with five children.  He and his wife are hard-working farmers who make a living through growing pineapple. He and his wife have been in this business for 30 years. He is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Savuth is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Сафаргуль жительница района Яван. Сафаргул замужем и имеет троих дочерей и двоих сыновей. Дети помогают ей продвигать деятельность. Сафаргуль на земле выращивает овощи. Сафаргуль такой деятельностью занимается около 15 лет. Сафаргуль всегда вкладывает в свой урожай душу. Она хочет получить богатый урожай и для этого Сафаргуль старается много работать. 
   К приходу весны Сафаргуль готовится посадить урожай. Она надеется на деньги от кредита купить семена овощей и горючей смеси для трактора. У Сафаргул возникли финансовые проблемы, из-за которой она обратилась за кредитом. Сафаргуль верит, что с помощью кредиторов KIVA она сохранить деятельность и закончит весенний посев.
texts.en:
Safargul is a resident of the Yavan region. Safargul is married and has three daughters and two sons. The children help her to advance her activities. On her land, Safargul raises vegetables. Safargul has been engaged in this kind of work for about 15 years. Safargul always puts her heart into her crop. She wants to receive a rich crop and for this Safargul tries to work hard.

With the arrival of spring, Safargul will prepare to plant the crop. She needs money from a loan to buy seeds and fuel mixture for a tractor. Safargul has financial problems and that is why she applied for a loan. Safargul believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she will preserve her activities and complete the spring planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel mixture for the tractor

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en: Laarni, a mother of five children, helps her husband operate their business to make a living. They have been selling nipa (used in thatching) in their village for three years, earning well to provide for the family. Aside from this her husband also earns money from working as driver. She plans to improve her business in order to earn more revenue and be able to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more palm leaves for nipa making. In the future she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more palm leaves for nipa making

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is 53 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Rosalita has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Ofelia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soft drinks, vinegar, groceries, etc. to sell.

Rosanna has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Rosanna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, vinegar, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en: Ma. Ana is 25 years old and married with two children. Ma. Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell. Ma. Ana has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut. Ma. Ana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Helen Grace works hard to support her family. She sells firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Helen Grace is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A married father of four children, Pov is aged 58, living in a rural village in Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support his family, he and his wife farm rice and work for others for a fee as the main sources of their family’s income and they have been in this business for 15 years. 

Pov is in his sixth loan cycle with VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him relieve his family’s burden. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan.  Pov is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Romela works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Romela is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 38, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with eight children. The family’s main sources of income are from growing rice and fishing. She has been in this business for 15 years, earning about 12,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Khoern has been with VisionFund for eight cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her relieve the family's burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Khoern is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 29 years old and married, with two children who currently live with her and her husband in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. 

Ry is in the business of farming rice and she operates a traveling sales business, selling beds around the province for extra profit for her family. She manages the two businesses with great support from her husband. She earns well from her current businesses.

Since it’s her first loan, Ry would like to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ry is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and single. She helps her parents to earn an income.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, sugar, shampoo, and soap.

Susana has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, sugar, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Elias has determination to improve his poor status of living. He is 50 years old and has four children in school. He aims to educate all his children so that they will be employed someday. Due to high school fees, he needs to increase his income in order to meet their necessities. In this regard, he planned to plant more kinds of vegetables and root crops to sell. Having inadequate capital, Elias is seeking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy herbicides and fertilizers and to pay the expenses incurred in planting vegetables. He believes that this loan will help him to improve his farming business and hopes that he will increase his production.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers and to pay the expenses incurred in planting vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru:
Гулшан молодая мать, которая одна растит ребенка. Ей 31 год. К сожалению Гулшан с мужем не сошлись с характерами и развелись.  Она очень трудолюбивая положительная молодая женщина. С детства любит шить. В данное время занимается тем, что шьет  одежду для женщин.   Но дохода от дела  для того чтобы растить  ребенка недостаточно. Гулшан хочет вырастить своего ребенка так , чтобы он вырос достойно, хочет дать хорошее образование ему в будущем. Для этого она работает не покладая рук. С ростом и развитием ребенка растут и потребности  в питании, одежде и транспорте.
 Гулшан  хочет начать оказанием дополнительной услуги по пошиву чехлов и оконных занавесок.  Для того чтобы расширить свое дело она хочет взять кредит для покупки швейной машины.  Она уже брала  заем в «Арванде» и довольна тем, что может снова обратиться за помощью  и получить необходимую сумму  для приближения своей заветной мечты и в будущем расширить сферу своей деятельности и тем самым повысить уровень жизни своей маленькой семьи.
texts.en:
Gulshan is a young mother, who is raising a young child on her own. She is 31 years old. Unfortunately, the characters of Gulshan and her husband did not get along and they divorced. She is a very hardworking, upbeat young woman. Since childhood, she has loved to sew. Currently, she is involved in sewing women's clothing. But income from the work is insufficient for raising a young child. Gulshan wants to raise her child such that he will grow up with dignity, and wants to give him a good education in the future. For this, she works tirelessly. As the child grows and develops, the needs for food, clothing, and transportation also grow.

Gulshan wants to start providing additional services sewing covers and window curtains. In order to expand her activity, she wants to take a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She already took a loan from Arvand and is pleased that she can once again request help and receive the needed amount to approach her treasured dream, and in the future to expand her sphere of activity and thus improve the living conditions of her small family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Age 44 years old, Lorn, is a rural villager from the Dambae district. She has four children. She earns a living through planting cassava and farming rice as her main sources of the family’s income, and she has been in this business for 24 years.  From her current business, she can earn about 23 USD per day to meet her family’s needs.  Lorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and has completely paid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university, faculty of Nursing. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in school.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is applying for a loan of $1000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 30 years old. She is running a rental in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy ink, paper, a copy machine and a printer. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Fernanda is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy ink, paper, a copy machine and a printer

loans.name: Saria Merari

texts.es: Saria es comerciante, tiene un pequeño cafetín, ella es soltera madre de un hijo en edad escolar que estudia en una escuela pública para equilibrar sus gastos, para Saria una de las dificultades que ha tenido es no contar con vivienda propia, pues habita en casa de su padre, es una joven de 35 años de edad que busca la manera de progresar económicamente con su negocio, solicita el crédito para invertir en productos como pan, jugos, galletas, café, sopas instantáneas, frutas para refrescos y así aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Saria is a businesswoman who owns a small coffee shop. She is a single mother with a school-aged son who attends public school because this helps Saria balance her expenses. 
One of the difficulties Saria has faced is not having a home of her own, she lives in his father's house. Saria is 35 years old and is looking to better herself economically through her business. She is asking for a loan to invest in products such as bread, juices, cookies, coffee, instant soups, fruits for soft-drinks, etc. and in this way increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase bread, juices, cookies, coffee, instant soup, fruit for soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rubiline

texts.en:
Rubiline works hard to support her family. She is single and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Rubiline requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Rubiline has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rubiline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Teofreda requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fish, ice and plastic bags for her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish, ice and plastic bags for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like toothpaste, groceries, milk, coffee, etc. to sell. Victoria has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like toothpaste, groceries, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
A 41-year-old mother residing in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Thy has five children to take care of and earns a living through growing rice and vegetables. To add more income, she has been producing palm sugar. Having been in this business for 18 years, she can earn about KHR 40,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs. 

Thy has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy cows to help her in her agricultural business. She hopes to grow more rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her in her agricultural business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.ru: Гульжамал 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшие дочери-замужем, сын в школе. У Гульжамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульжамал занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульжамал, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 8 овец, также имеется 1,75 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульжамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа удобрений для обработки земли. Гульжамал намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Гульжамал планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование сына.
texts.en:
Guljamal is 50 and married with three children. Her older daughters are married and her son is in school. Guljamal has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 19 years ago with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one milking cow and eight sheep as well as 1.75 hectares of farmland, on which she grows beans both for household consumption and for sale. Her total monthly income is 10,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Guljamal has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her land. She wants to receive a good harvest, which will contribute positively to her household finances. Guljamal plans to invest profits from the loan into buying more animals, and to save toward her son's education costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru:
Ориф жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 51 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Сам Ориф занимается земледелием и животноводством. Он выращивает на своей земле некоторую сельхозкультуру и пасёт скот. Хотя это сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит Орифу доход. 

Но основным и стабильным бизнесом Орифа является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Орифу хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Ориф обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Ориф заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Orif is a cheerful man of 51 years. He is married and has three children. He has a very harmonious family. They live in a rural region. In order to have an income in the family, all the family members try to do whatever they can to earn a living. Everyone works as he is able. Orif himself is engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry. He grows several crops on his own land and tends cattle. Thought this is seasonal work, it still brings Orif an income.

However, Orif's main and stable business is raising livestock. He breeds and sells livestock. He is helped in this work by his wife. She cares for the livestock and also sells their milk. The livestock business brings Orif a good and stable income. Therefore, he wishes to expand this business. He needs to buy another few heads of cattle for raising and subsequent sale. For this, Orif applied to Arvand to get a loan to purchase livestock. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring more income in order to meet with quality the needs of the family. Orif thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming rice and vegetables for 22 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 64 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming rice for 35 years and earns additional income from rice milling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy soap, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell .

Victoria has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vanthat

texts.en:
Vanthat is 35 years old and married with four children. She and her family live in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for 15 years, earning about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Vanthat is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to pay for labor fees to harvest cassava. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to harvest cassava

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
Tin, 60, lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of six children. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy. To supplement the income, she has been working for others for a fee as well. She has been in this business for 12 years. From the current business, she can earn about 27,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR per day for future needs.
 
Tin has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already, and she completely repaid previous loans. With the loan from VisionFund, she has successfully managed her business to better support her daily needs. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Tin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay labor fees

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Vy is 31 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 12 years, she manages to earn about 10,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Vy’s group of two. Both group members are female and have been members of VisionFund for four cycles already. Vy successfully used the past loan to better support her daily needs and her children’s education. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Vy wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sokly is a 28-year-old mother of two children. To make a living, cassava planting has been the only source of her family’s income  for eight years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,700 KHR per day. 

Sokly is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of the loan on labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Davaajav is 50 years old and lives with his wife in a newly built house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan, he and his wife built their dream house and are very grateful to Kiva. He has been transporting goods between districts for six years. His wife makes and sells Mongolian traditional clothes for a living. He is requesting a loan of $1,400 (USD) to buy textiles and a welding machine for his wife's business. During this time, orders for traditional clothes increases greatly and it is a big opportunity for his wife to generate big profits. All family members are trying their best to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy textiles and a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various type of snacks, such as candy, chips, bread, beans, noodles, and various types of biscuits

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy is 39 years old, married with two dependent children, and lives in a remote area in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She was born to a family of farmers and has learned farming from her parents. She has spent most of her lifetime working in agriculture, primarily growing rice and beans, which she sells at the local markets.

Hoy is asking for a loan to pay land rental fees and buy beans for the maintenance of her farm. Her goal is to increase production so her children can get a good education. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to pay land rental fees and buy beans for the maintenance of her farm.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is 54 year old, married, and has three children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family. Xuan and her husband earn money through their business of running a general store. 

At times, Xuan is unable to provide the items required by her customers. Consequently she requested a loan, which she will use to buy a large stock of different products such as detergents, shampoo, bags, and other basic goods to meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, shampoo, bags, and others basic goods to sell

loans.name: Djidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIDIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kenikela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, d’habillement, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJIDIA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA la personne assise n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter 75 kg de sucre, 1 carton de thé 1 de Lipton et du sachet plastique chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group called Djidia is composed of married women who are on average 45 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kenikela, Massigui commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family ties or through bonds of neighborhood and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, clothing, and various articles. The women of the Djidia group are on their fifth solidarity loan. Wishing to satisfy the enormous demand of their clientele, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso. The loans will be used to buy their merchandise as mentioned above. 

Fatoumata, the woman seated in the photo, has had no education. She is presently selling various goods. She intends to buy 75 kilos of sugar, one carton of tea, one of Lipton's, and plastic bags from the wholesalers at the weekly market. Her sales are made retail and for cash, in her home, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be reinvested in her small business.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale

loans.name: Kokadje Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOKADJE est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 36ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tenimbougou, commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de baigne, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe KOKADJE sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente DJOURA  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de gâteau. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de farine boulangère, 6 litres d’huile, 1 paquet de levure, et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes à Dioïla. Elle le transforme en gâteau de bonne qualité, et le produit final sera mis dans des emballages. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 Fcfa qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de petit ruminant.
texts.en:
The group called Kokadje is composed of married women who are on average 36 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tenimbougou, Kaladougou commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family ties or through bonds of neighborhood and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, soap, fritters, and cakes. The women of the Kokadje group are on their fifth solidarity loan. Wishing to satisfy the enormous demand of their clientele, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Djoura, the woman standing second from the left, has had no education. She is presently selling cookies. She intends to buy one sack of baking flour, 6 litres of oil, one packet of baking powder, and plastic bags from the wholesalers at Dioïla. She transforms the ingredients into high quality cookies and packs up the final product.  Her sales are made retail and for cash, in her home and sometimes on foot, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 10,000 F CFA which will be reinvested in her small livestock-raising business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cookies to sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer carismática con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas desde hace 4 años y también tiene su pequeño negocio de costurería; ello le ha permitido poder tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder salir delante.

Gabriela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de golosinas como chizitos, chocolates, galletas, entre otros productos al por mayor y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ventas y seguir esforzándose y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una bodega más grande”.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a charismatic woman who wants to get ahead in life. That's why, with a lot of effort, she started her business selling candy four years ago. She also has s small sewing workshop. This has allowed her to generate income to cover the household expenses and move ahead.
Gabriela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy merchandise for her candy business, such as cheese puffs, chocolate, cookies and other wholesale products. In this way, she will improve her sales and she will continue to work hard to make her biggest dream come true: "to own a bigger grocery store".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Asuncion has been in this business for ten years. Asuncion earns more income from selling Ready-To-Wear and from her general store.

Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 51 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Lorena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Lorena has been farming rice and vegetables for thirty years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of foods and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nun's Group

texts.en:
Nun, 55, is married with one child, residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last 30 years, she has been farming rice. From the current business, she earns about KHR 30,000 per day. 

Nun’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Nun has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle already. The past loan from VisionFund Cambodia has helped her to better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Nun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда добрая женщина. Ей 33 года. Она разведенная и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами 11 лет назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей детской одежды. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательным и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5100 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavlyuda is a kind woman. She is 33 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children. In order to provide her children with all of the necessities, she started her own business 11 years ago of buying and selling children's clothing. Her efficiency helps her to be successful in business. She sells her merchandise at the local market and has a large circle of customers. She has good taste and is able to pick out merchandise that is in high demand. In spite of all of her accomplishments, the strong competition of the business world forces her to be attentive and get new merchandise every season. She needs to buy merchandise for the new season, but she does not have enough money for this. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,100 somoni to buy merchandise for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOTALA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 52 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Tenimbougou, commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de poisson, et du lait. Les femmes du groupe KOTOTALA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente GNA la troisième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 1 sac d’oignon, 1 sac de 1 sac de feuille de baobab en poudre, 10 kg de beurre de karité, et de la potasse, chez les grossistes à Dioïla. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, chez elle à une clientèle composé uniquement de femme. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000 FCFA qui sera réinjecter dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group KOTOTALA is composed of married women, who average 52 years of age and three children each.
