Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and one small daughter in a small, simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Mohammad decided to open a grocery store 10 years ago. It is a good project and helps him with part of the family expenses. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to expand his store and buy more products to resell to the local traders. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his business and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand his store and buy more products to resell to the local traders

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Jabalia. Majed recently opened a small stall for making and selling traditional food such as falafel and hummus. 

Majed requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy new stove and tools for his restaurant. With the loan, Majed will be able to improve his business and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new stove and tools for his restaurant

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 56 and married with children. She is a hardworking woman. She has raised her children with sacrifice; she wants them to be women of good character.

She has had a grocery store for ten years and works hard to grow and get ahead. Thanks to the store, she was able to give her children everything she could not have for herself, making sure they do not have unfulfilled needs.

Ludy requested a loan to buy beverages, sugar, rice, flour and more supplies to stock her store and continue working as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, spices and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Juan Alpidio

texts.es:
Juan es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 28 años de edad, se ha dedicado desde pequeño a realizar las labores del campo, ya que aprendió a ser agricultor por medio de las enseñanzas de sus padres. Tenía varios cultivos, pero debido al incremento de los costos de producción y la disminución en el precio de venta de los productos, lo obligaron a cambiar de actividad y, hoy en día, se dedica a cultivar flores en la finca donde reside, adicionalmente se asoció con un amigo en otro cultivo donde se produce la flor áster; esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos y dar sustento a su esposa y su único hijo de 6 años.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos agrícolas como abonos, riegos y otros, esto le permitirá continuar produciendo una flor de excelente calidad con la cual podrá ser más competitivo en el mercado, además le ayudará para generar ingresos que le permitan tramitar los permisos necesarios para poder exportar su producto al exterior y mejorar así la rentabilidad del negocio.
Juan, con su espíritu emprendedor y su proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, lo motivan para seguir trabajando arduamente y llegar a cumplir el sueño de tener su microempresa bien organizada y estructurada, con todos los permisos necesarios para llevar su producto al exterior, lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Juan is an unassuming farmer and worker who is 28 years old.  Ever since he was small, he has been working in the fields, because he learned to farm through the teachings of his parents.  He used to have a variety of crops, but due to the increasing costs of production and the falling prices of the products, he found it necessary to change his specialization.  Today he works cultivating flowers on a farm where he lives.  In addition, he partnered with a friend to grow aster flowers on another plot.  This has enabled him to generate sufficient resources to cover the basic expenses and support his wife and only child, who is 6 years old.

With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, irrigation supplies, and other items.  This will allow him to continue to product excellent quality flowers so that he will be more competitive in the market.  In addition, it will help him to generate resources to carry out the paperwork and obtain the permits needed to export his products outside the country.  This will also increase the profitability of his business.

With his enterprising spirit and motivation to accomplish his goals, Joan will continue to work very hard to accomplish his dream: to have his own well-organized and structured business with all of the permits needed to take his products outside the country.  This will enable him to improve his quality of life and his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, irrigation supplies, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $3,000 helped Ayad to pay for his son's college tuition.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 45-years-old who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a small shop where he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income to the household expenses. He has always tried to establish his business by offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are in very high demand and expensive as well. He is not financially strong enough to buy these expensive beauty products.

This the reason Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  She will give the full amount to her husband so he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount the business will be enhanced. 

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, diapers, sugar, milk, etc.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, diapers, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
This is the first loan of Kiran; she wants to take another loan in the future.
She is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Kiran is a 25-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruits shop. He owns a fruits shop and participating in household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal and fresh fruits. Now he wants to increase the stocks on daily basis so he can generate maximum income. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy fresh fruits in large quantities. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her, and she will save reasonable amount soon.

Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits to resell in fruits shop.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de l’habillement, et de charbon de bois des draps de lit et rideaux. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AMINATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle coud est actuellement et vend des draps et rideaux. Elle compte acheter 2 rouleaux de popeline, des rouleaux de fil, et le transforme en drap et rideau de qualité. La vente se fait en espèce, et a crédit dans le village et ses environs, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinjecter dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of married women averaging 44 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, Kaladougou municipality, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali).They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cereals, clothing, charcoal, bed linens and curtains. The group members are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting very large customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loan funds will be used to buy their merchandise mentioned above. Our client Aminata, the second  one from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She current sews bed linens and curtains for sale. She plans to buy two rolls of popline and some thread in order to sew linens and curtains. She sells retail, for cash and on credit, in her village and nearby areas, to a mixed clientele. She  expects to earn a monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing linens and curtains.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 43 years old and married with four children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from her restaurant.

Cheryl aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Lahsie Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lahsie Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling peanuts, baluts and vegetables. Lahsie Grace is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice, peanuts and baluts to sell in her food stall.

Lahsie Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, peanuts and baluts to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like fishing nets, etc.  Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like fishing nest, etc

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is a 37 year-old male.  He lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda.  He has a retail and wholesale business and also sells paraffin to add to his income.  His business is located in Walukuba landing site.  Manuel started the business to earn a living, using the little savings he got from fishing. He has a great dream of building a permanent home, though he was challenged by inadequate capital.  He intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise, like sugar and soap, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 32 years old and lives in Taxila, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working as a plumber for many years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Bushra is providing sewing services and earning an income to help her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su querida familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de su humilde vivienda la cual esta hecha a base de lámina la cual se encuentra deteriorada y es necesario hacer la mejor lo antes posible. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Reina espera poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales y tiene fe que con su trabajo de empleada doméstica y con el apoyo de su compañero de vida lograrán cancelar el crédito y continuar contando con el apoyo de esta Fundación el el futuro cercano para nuevas necesidades.
texts.en:
Reina wishes to improve her and her family’s living conditions, and that’s why she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to repair her humble house. It is made out of sheets of metal, which are damaged, and she needs to change this situation as soon as possible. With the amount requested she will buy galvanized sheet and wood. 

Reina hopes to give her family better housing conditions. She has faith that with her job as a housekeeper and with the support of her life partner, they will be able to pay for the loan and maintain the support of this foundation in future needs.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet and wood to repair the roof and walls of her house.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Melita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Melita is borrowing PHP 5500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Mila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her oyster farm.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lany is 32 years old and two of her children are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lany requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lany has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lany would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rosa has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merla is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. Merla requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Merla has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 43 year-old lady, residing in Taxila, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children, and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for the past twelve years.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and for managing the household.
Kosar's husband wants to purchase animals for his business. but, due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these cattle.
Therefore, Kosar has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business.  This will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income to be derived from his business.
Of this financial assistance, Kosar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy animals for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 35 year-old male, who lives in Masindi-Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Robert has a produce business whereby he sells cereals. He has a taxi vehicle for additional  income. His business is located on a busy street where the general public can access him. Robert started the business for sustainability of his family needs. Robert has a great dream of building a permanent home and enlarging his business.  He wants a loan to buy cereals, such as peas, to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals, such as peas, to sell.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga una joven ecuatoriana nacida en el cantón de Pujilí de la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador, este cantón es muy reconocido por sus tradiciones y su agricultura. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera vive junto a su pequeño hijo, con mucho sacrificio y dedicación Olga terminó sus estudios primarios y logró también obtener un título como costurera profesional, es hasta ahí donde sus padres le apoyaron. Luego ella por si sola tuvo que conseguir las maneras de poder salir adelante, desde muy pequeña le enseñaron el arte de la agricultura y cría de ganado. Olga ha sido muy luchadora y por su pequeño hijo, quien le llena de alegría, ha tenido que luchar muy duro para poder regalarle a su hijo una mejor vida y lograr que él sea un gran profesional lleno de valores y principios, que ella desde muy pequeño le ha ido inculcando.
Olga construyó su casa con mucho esfuerzo pero a la vez con mucha alegría y orgullo ya que su madre le heredo un pequeño terreno, lamentablemente no la ha podido terminar de construir por falta de recursos económicos, y es por esta razón que solicita el crédito ya que vio en la institución, una mano para poder terminar de construir su humilde hogar y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a la de su hijo. Olga agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Olga's a young Ecuadorian who was born in Pujilí Canton in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador.  This canton is very well known for its traditions and agriculture.

Olga's 44 years old and the single mother of a young son.  She finished elementary school with a lot of sacrifice and dedication.  She also got a diploma as a professional seamstress.  Her parents supported her up to that point, then she had to find a way to get ahead on her own.  Her parents taught her the art of agriculture and ranching from a young age.

Olga has been very persevering on behalf of her little boy, who fills her with happiness.  She has had to strive very hard to be able to give him a better life so he'll be a great professional full of values and principles, which she has instilled in him since he was little.

Olga built her house with a lot of effort, happiness, and pride when her mother left her a small piece of land.  Unfortunately Olga hasn't been able to finish building because she lacks the money.  This is why she's requesting a loan, which she saw as a way to help finish building her modest home and improve her quality of life and her son's.

Olga's grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making her personal and business growth possible.

loans.use: to finish building her home

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Salma is a businesswoman who devotes her lifetime to three projects. For five years now, she has been running a grocery, selling beers and soft drinks like soda, water and juices. A beauty salon is her second business, which she has had for seven years now.  Lastly, Salma has a poultry business where she raises 400 chicks. She is aged in her early forties and has two boys and a girl. Salma's children are in school. She works from 08:00am to mid-night hours and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Salma used to be a customer of Tujijenge Tanzania but she stopped taking loans after her business fell in terms of sales. She is now turning back for a loan. She will use this loan to buy salon equipment and crates of beers and soft drinks for her businesses. Salma used her previous loans to start her poultry business and restocked on other business items. Salma paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She used her profit to buy a TV, sofa set, computer for her kids to learn, and covered part of school fees and home food expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to buy a car for her poultry business. It cost much  for Salma to buy chicken feed and other requirements for the poultry area. 

Salma will share this loan with her loan group" mango” which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and crate of beers and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
DUO DAMAS LABORIOSOS
La señorita Maria del Carmen de 41 años, casada. Desde hace 6 años posee una venta de leña ubicada en camino a Canaan Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de señorita Maria del Carmen, es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar mas leña por mayor para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
"DUO DAMAS LABORIOSOS", the Duo of Hardworking Women
Maria del Carmen is 41 years old and she is married. For the past 6 years she has run a firewood sales business, located on the road going to Canaan Chimaltenango. Through hard work she has managed to build and improve her home, and through her business she has supported her family and helped them get ahead. Her dream is to further improve her family's quality of life, through the loan she is requesting from Kiva. She hopes to use the loan to purchase more firewood so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood in bulk, which they will then sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn earns a living from helping her husband work on their own farm for a living.  For six years, Marilyn earned well and was able to improve the farm.  Her husband also work in their village as a carpenter, and he earns extra income. To buy fertilizer, she took loan from GDMPC micro-credit.  She hopes to have more returns from her farm in order to generate additional income for the purpose of improving the  general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is forty years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell in her store. Rosalie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is twenty-nine years old and has six children. His business deals in a local brew known as waragi. Andrew also earns an additional income from farming. He started his waragi business in 1996 with the aim of earning a living and paying for his children's education. In his business, Andrew faces a challenge of rainy seasons, which make transportation of stock to his customers difficult. He will use the loan to buy more waragi to sell.

loans.use: to buy more waragi for selling.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 32 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Joan has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and natasha products.

Joan aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from buying and selling rice.  Angelita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is 41 years old and lives with his wife and six children in a Ger (a traditional nomadic yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Altantsetseg works at a local company. His six children are all under the age of 18 and attend a local public school. 

Jargal has been running a taxi service business in town since 2008. He loves driving people to where they want to go. He is thinking of purchasing a truck to transport goods and other stuff to increase his income. 

Jargal is now requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to install on his car and ensure his business stability. He is a hardworking and caring man who is now trying very hard to start saving for his children's further study. His older daughter is 18 and will be enrolling in university next year.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to install on his car and ensure his business stability

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a boarding house business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her business.

Yolanda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the repair of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory to sell at her rented stall.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre humilde, carismático y trabajador de 41 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 2 años, inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicada en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside, la idea surgió por la necesidad de generar recursos que le permitieran solventar los gastos familiares, pues en ese momento estaba pasando por una difícil situación económica.
Con el ánimo de acreditar su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una vitrina refrigerante, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para ofrecer y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando los ingresos que percibe por la labor.
Nelson manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un mini mercado, en el que todos los clientes encuentren los productos que requieran y así mejorar la rentabilidad, para que le brinde la capacidad brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Nelson is a humble, charismatic, and hardworking man, age 41.  He is married and is the father of two children, whom he has gotten ahead with great effort and dedication.  Two years ago, he began his own business, a grocery store located at the market plaza of the town where he lives.  The idea came out of the need to earn money that would allow him to take care of the family expenses, for at that time he was going through a difficult financial situation.

With the goal of better establishing his business, he is asking for the help of a loan to buy a refrigerated display case, which will allow him to have a greater variety of items to offer.  In this way he can meet the needs of his customers, improving the earnings that he receives for his work.

Nelson shares that his greatest desire is to expand his business and turn it into a mini-market where his customers could find the items they need and thus improve his profits, giving him the ability to provide a better quality of life and wellbeing to his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to make alterations in her workspace.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 54-year-old separated mother of four from Thika. She is a business woman dealing with mixed farming. She has been in the farming business for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan she has applied,Lucy plans to start a hotel business as a secondary source of income. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standards of living for her family and use the remaining amount for the education of her children. 

In the future, Lucy would like to expand her farming land. She hopes to become a prominent farmer as well as continue with hotel business as she looks forward to a successful business life in Thika.

loans.use: to start a hotel business as a secondary source of income

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 42-year-old man from the Kakamega region, which is found in the Western part of Kenya. He is a married man who supports 3 family members. 

He has a barber shop that has been operating for the last 2 years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He also owns a construction business to supplement his income from the barber shop. He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and will use it to buy timber to dry the bricks after he makes as part of his construction business.  He then sells the bricks.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand his construction business. 

His dream is to be successful in business and be able to support his family with much ease.

loans.use: to buy timber to help make more bricks for his construction business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 44-year-old lady from Kisumu, married to Onyancha with whom she has five children who are all grown-ups. She sells plastic containers and second-hand clothes, earning a monthly income of Kes 50,000.

This the fourth loan she is taking with VisionFund Kenya, of Kes 70,000 to use in installing electricity in her home. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more bales of clothes and plastic containers.

Her dream is to become a wholesaler and bring up a stable family

loans.use: To install electricity in her home

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, aged thirty-four, is a villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kompong Cham Province. She has three children. For fourteen years, Nat has been growing cassava and farming rice. Additionally, she sometimes works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She used the loans successfully and managed to pay back the entire loan. Now, she is leading a group to ask for a loan. Chanthou will use her loan portion not only to buy seeds and fertilizers but also to pay for harvesting fees for her farmland. She hopes to receive a higher crop yield to earn more income to lease an additional plot of farmland for expanding her paddy rice growing business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en: Jovans is an old-time client of UGAFODE Microfinance, having borrowed four times. She thanks the Kiva lenders for lending towards her previous loan that helped to increase her production. She is a farmer in a rural part of Ruhumoro Sub-county in the Bushenyi District. She grows tea and she has done this since 1994. It was an activity she started with the hope of making enough money to cater to the needs of her family. Jovans is a mother of eleven children and ten of them are in school. The reason why she has to work hard and look for money is to see all her children through school. Tea growing is her sole source of income and she gives it much time so that she can get enough income in return. She has applied for a loan of two million shillings so that she can use it to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of her soils, and to harvest much more and hence earn enough profits as a reward for her hard work. Her clients are mainly tea traders who later take the tea to the factories in the same area. Her dream is to see all the children through school using the meager resources. She believes that if the loan is given, she will earn enough profits since the harvests will be larger as a result of fertile soils. Her major challenge is the dry season which affects the tea and her income negatively. However, she hopes that if the loan is given she will beat the odds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Joannadel

texts.en: Joannadel, 30 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store and a restaurant where she sells noodles for snacks. Her net income from her business is usually spent on food and daily expenditures. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase rice grains, canned goods, and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and be more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase rice grains, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 26-year-old mother who was gifted with two children. She owns and manages a small variety store to help her husband generate income. 

She aims to improve her store and make it more profitable in order to generate sufficient income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of soft drinks, sugar, snack foods, beverages, and seasonings to resell in their community. 

She believes that her loan will be a great help to her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, sugar, snack foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 26-year-old lady, married to Simon and a mother of two children who are six and four years old, respectively. She has been operating a beauty salon on the outskirts of Narok town in Kenya for the last year. Her monthly income is about KES 20,000. 

She learned about VisionFund through another customer. She has borrowed her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund, which she intends to use to purchase hair extensions and weaves for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to buy a dairy cow.

Her dream is to grow her business and open more beauty shops

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 40-year-old divorced lady and a mother of three. She has been running a beauty saloon in the outskirts of Narok town in Kenya for the last nine years, and her monthly income is around kes 30,000. 

She has been advanced a fourth loan of kes 20,000, which she will use to buy hair extensions and weaves for the business. The proceeds will be used to buy more saloon equipment. 

Her dream is to develop the beauty saloon to an executive level.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Sheilah

texts.en:
Sheilah  is a 28-year-old mother from Kakamega County. She is married to Morris, who is a businessman, and together they have four children who are between the ages of 12 and 7 years old.

Sheilah sells snacks, a business she has been doing for the last four years, and makes a monthly income of KES 23,000. She is now taking her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to buy more fish for resale. She will use her anticipated profits to plough back into the business.

Her hopes are to provide for her family with a better future and become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is a 29 year old man blessed with one child.  He operates a cereals shop in Mareneni, which he has been running for two years. Safari earns a monthly income of 6,050 KES.

Safari is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more cereals to sell to his customers.He will use the profit to expand the current business. Safari's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the current business and educate his child.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell

loans.name: Topista

texts.en: Topista, aged 47, is the mother of three children. She operates a bar in a rural township of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in business for six years now and says she used to be in the piggery business before starting her own bar. Besides the bar, she deals in selling beans and maize to earn additional income for her family. Her challenges are high license fees and price fluctuations of produce products.She hopes to have a well stocked bar in her area.Topista intends to use the loan to buy beer, sodas, and airtime to sell in her bar.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and airtime to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Kabukye United Womens Group

texts.en:
Susan is 43 year old and lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of eight children, all of whom attend school. She started her produce business 10 years ago selling cereals in a market stall. Susan does farming to increase her income. She has a great dream of constructing a house and educating all of her children. However, she is challenged by seasonal changes and lack of enough capital to expand her business. She has applied for a loan to buy more cereals like maize to sell.
 
She is a member of a group where they guarantee one another whether they are taking a loan or not. That's why there are many members in the photo but only 10 members are taking the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cereals like maize to sell

loans.name: Danni Magali

texts.es:
MAGALI, es una mujer de 31 años y tiene  4 hijos vive en Borbón y su esposo falleció en alta mar en faenas de pesca hace 3 años; desde entonces Magali vió la alternativa en un negocio propio y con $60,oo  empezó preparar y vender papas fritas en los buses.
Ahora con este préstamo Magali comprará: arroz, azúcar, plátano, pollos, pañales desechables, huevos, embutidos, leche y otros productos de primera necesidad para aprovechar el espacio que tiene en su casa y poner una tienda ya que en el barrio no hay tiendas de alimentos.
Magali se considera muy luchadora y colaboradora y espera crecer mucho con esta tienda y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y sus deseos de ser futbolistas.
texts.en:
Magali is a 31 year old woman.  She has four children, and she lives in Borbón.  Her husband died three years ago on an offshore fishing job.  After that, Magali looked at the option of her own business.  With $60 she started to prepare and sell French fries on buses.

Magali will now use this loan to buy rice, sugar, bananas, chicken, disposable diapers, eggs, sausages, milk, and other basic needs products.  She will do this in order to take advantage of the space that she has in her house.  She will set up a store because there are no food stores in the neighborhood.

Magali is considered to be very tenacious and cooperative.  She hopes to grow a lot with this store and to support her children in their education and their desire to be soccer players.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bananas, chicken, disposable diapers, eggs, sausages, and milk.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials.

Caridad has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Caridad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is fifty-eight years old and married with twelve children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Nida has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Nida has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her float account for her money-transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for soap making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 kilos of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothing designs and introduce new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuff, cooking oil, and detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Saheang's Group

texts.en: Saheang, 35, is a married mother of four children. She grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has 10 years of experience in rice farming and several years in working for others. From these various businesses, she can earn about KHR30,000 per day. Saheang has been with VisionFund for three cycles and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a shrewd businesswoman in Nyakasharu in Rubirizi District. She owns a retail shop, which is her major source of income. She started it in 2009 with high hopes that the business would reward her, and she sustains her family. Justine is a married woman, and she has four children who are all in school. She also does some farming, though on a small scale, but this contributes to her incomes in a given period. 

She works six days per week and rests only on Sundays with much hope that she will achieve much if the six days in a week are put to proper use. 

Justine would like to use the loan money amounting to one million shillings to buy more business stock so that she can meet the needs of her customers, thereby maximizing sales and profits. Her customers are mainly residents of the village, and she believes that with their support she will make more sales, expand her business and be in position to cater for the needs of her family. She is challenged by inadequate capital; that is the reason why she is asking for a loan, and she believes that this will not be a challenge anymore if the loan is granted.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for selling

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is thirty. She is the mother of one dependent kid who is still in school. To provide for the entire household, she sells grocery items and farming rice. To earn additional income, she also works for others for a fee. Ra has been in this business for several years and is able to earn about 80,000 KHR. 

Ra is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Siny's Group

texts.en:
Siny is 42 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham. She has three children. 

Siny has been involved in rice farming and cassava growing for 22 years, and it is her main source of income. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Siny is just with VisionFund for this cycle and is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to pay for the rental land fee in order to grow her rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for the rental land fee in order to grow her rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer responsable y amigable que pertenece al banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario", ella continua ayudando a su esposo en la elaboración de muebles de madera con el acabado de los muebles. En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere otro préstamo adicional para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Virginia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.(Este crédito se les otorga a los clientes que son responsables y puntuales con el pago de las cuotas). 

Este préstamo es parte del "Programa Yapa" a la Asociación Arariwa, que permite los prestatarios con un buen historial crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo: un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de cuatro meses.
texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible and friendly woman who belongs to the Mamacha Rosario community bank.  She continues to help her husband by finishing the wooden furniture he builds.  

Virginia is requesting another loan to purchase more materials, for example, wood.  She has been doing this work for many years and it is going well thanks to the dedication she gives to her work.

Virginia is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her repayments according to the set schedule.  (This loan is given to clients who are responsible and on time with their repayments.)

This loan is part of the "Yapa Program" at Asociación Arariwa that allows borrowers with a good credit history to receive a special loan: a small loan in addition to their regular loan that has a flexible loan schedule of four months.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Huancarani y continúa participando en el banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario".  Porfirio se dedica a la venta de materiales de ferreterías como por ejemplo clavos, calaminas, herramientas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. Porfirio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Este crédito se les otorga a los clientes que son responsables y puntuales con el pago de las cuotas).

Este préstamo es parte del "Programa Yapa" de la Asociación Arariwa, que permite los prestatarios con un buen historial de crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo: un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de cuatro meses.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Huancarani and continues to participate in the communal bank Mamacha Rosario. Porfirio works selling hardware store supplies such as nails, corrugated iron, tools and other items. He has been in this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Porfirio is grateful for the opportunity offered though this means and he agrees to comply with the payment schedule granted to customers who are responsible and punctual in the payment of the fees.

This loan is part of the "Yapa Program" at Asociación Arariwa that allows borrowers with a good credit history to receive a special loan: a small loan in addition to their regular loan that has a flexible loan schedule of four months.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as wire, metallic roofing, nails and other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Marites is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 44 years old and married with three children who are in school; Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

She has requested a PHP 2000 loan through NWTF to restart her food vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Lina is committed to rebuilding her business, and in the future would like to to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation in addition she also sells food in a food stall to supplement her income. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 



With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to pay school fees for her kids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with eleven children. Five of her children are in school. 

Myrna is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business selling native delicacies in the Philippines and has been in this business for 25 years.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her native delicacies.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to build a bakery at a public market and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her native delicacies.

loans.name: Kinyobwa Nyekundire Group

texts.en:
Kinyobwa Nyekundire is a new group located in Nyanga parish, Rubaare Ntungamo district. It is composed of men and women whose major activities are rearing goats and a banana plantation. They get little income from their businesses due to poor farming methods and poor breeds. Their prime goal is to yield high output from their plantations, also to take their children to better schools in the country. But they are limited by capital and funds to enable them to achieve their dreams, so they came for the loan to buy good breeds of goats, and manure so as to improve on their production and income in the long run.

Jolly will use the loan to buy organic manure for her banana plantation so that she can improve her output and achieve better yields since she anticipates higher sales in the next few months.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Rwashamaire Tukore 1 Group

texts.en:
Rwashamaire Tukore group members are repeat borrowers who all operate their small business in the same area.  They are hard working and some of their children so far have reached tertiary institutions.  They have been with this bank for over four years.  Their testimonies say the Ugafode loans have changed their lifestyles and are better than they were.  They are applying for another loan.  

Ketty, a widow within the group, will specifically use the loan to pay tuition for her daughter, who is completing her ordinary level exams this year.  She is grateful for the assistance the organization has brought and for the group members, for guaranteeing her despite her lack of collateral. She is hard working and committed to maintaining the relationship with the Kiva's lenders, UGAFODE and her fellow group members.
Pictured are the group members with their credit officer (he is on the extreme right).

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 32 years old and has two children. She is a villager from the Moung Russey district where crop farming is common. 

She is a farmer who grows rice as her primary business and has been in this business for ten years. In addition, she works for others for a fee to gain more income. 

Heang has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The loans have helped her to better make a living. She currently earns 35,000 KHR per day and saves more than 24,000 KHR daily. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Heang is going to use her portion to plow the paddy field. She hopes that the prices of her crops will increase soon, so she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to plow the paddy field

loans.name: Sana's Group

texts.en:
Sana is 28 years old and lives in Taxila, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Sana has requested a group loan with another member from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Sana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Juliana, who is in her mid forties, is married and has three sons who are in school. For four years now, Juliana has been managing a shop selling clothes. In order to raise extra income and make her life better, Juliana started a new nursery school service. She runs her business from 6am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy stocks of clothes to make her shop attractive. She used her previous loans to buy stocks of clothes, and paid back all successfully. Juliana started her business with small capital, and used the loans she received to buy more clothes to make her shop grow. She received an extra income which she used to build extra classes for her nursery school. Juliana covered part of her children's school fees and home food expenses. In the coming years, Juliana would like to improve her life and businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" SARANGA" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes to make her shop attractive.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a 44-year-old married man. He has three children, ranging from two years to seven years old. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant place. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more bags to sell. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 
For the past four years, she has operated a fruit selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale and resell them at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale and resell them at a profit.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy more items for her shop. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

The more items displayed at the retail shop, the better. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana tiene 40 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado pues la situación económica de aquellos tiempos era muy difícil y no le permitió continuar, ahora ella está casada y su esposo es vigilante de una empresa de gas, tiene un hijo como fruto de su matrimonio el cual está estudiando en la escuela, y solo su hijo es quien dependen de ella.

Ana es muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en todo el caserío donde ella vive, ya tiene tres años de experiencia, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre que desde pequeña le enseñó, pues en esa época salía con su madre a vender frutas en un desvió, además ella elabora tamales un día por medio y esto de igual forma lo sale a vender en un canasto, este trabajo lo hace en un horario de 8:00 AM  a 12:00 MD. 
Ella necesita muchísimo de este préstamo, para comprar más verduras como papas,  zanahoria, güisquil, tomates y pepino, también para comprar hojas para envolver los tamales, esto le ayudará mucho porque comprando más vende más, además obtiene mayores ingresos para el hogar, y no se verá estancada en sus negocios por falta de fondos.

El propósito a futuro de Ana, es tener una tienda en su casa ya que desde pequeña le ha gustado el negocio y hoy que tiene la oportunidad desea aprovechar con la ayuda de los préstamos, además quiere superarse y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, age 40, was only able to go to school through the third grade.  The economic situation during those times was very difficult.  It did not allow her to continue.  She is now married.  Her husband is a watchman for a gas company.  They have one child, and he is going to school.  Only her son is dependent upon her.

Ana is very hard-working.  She sells fruit and vegetables in the entire neighborhood where she lives.  She now has three years of experience.  She learned this business activity from her mother, who taught her when she was little.  At that time, she went out with her mother to sell fruit at a crossroads.  She also makes tamales for half a day, and then goes to sell them in a basket.  Her schedule for this work is from 8:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

She really needs this loan to buy more vegetables like potatoes, carrots, chayote [a type of squash], tomatoes, and cucumbers.  She also wants to buy leaves to wrap the tamales.  This will help her a lot because the more she buys the more she sells.  Also, she gets better income for her household.  Her business will not be brought to a standstill due to lack of funds.

Ana’s plan for the future is to have a store in her house.  She has liked the business since she was little.  Now she has the opportunity, and she wants to take advantage of the help of the loans.  Also, she wants to succeed and to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like potatoes, carrots, chayote [a type of squash], tomatoes, and cucumbers.  She also wants to buy leaves to wrap the tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and other retail commodities

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Aisha is aged in her late 30s and has two kids who are in school. For 20 years now, Aisha has had a business of a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics in the same shop. She is single and taking care for her two daughters. She opens her business from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This is Aisha's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy business hair products and cosmetics. She sold all of her cosmetic stock. Aisha paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She received an extra income, which she used to buy a farm and TV. She covered school fees and household expenses. 

Aisha will use this loan to start selling small dry fishes known as dagaa. She dreams that one day, she will be able to be a successful businesswoman. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Embassy," which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling small dry fishes known as dagaa.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen    is   married with one child and her only child goes to school.  She also take care of additional family members (father).She has a business of selling cosmetics and   has been in this business for 4 years.  She works in a  shop  seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1200,000 to buy more   boxes of braids, weaves,hair oil,hair treatments . she works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on  retail basis.  Her major business challenges includes transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked cosmetics shop and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides  in the family  house and the family has  access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes  school fees, feeding the family and paying for utility bills.
  Sani

loans.use: To buy more boxes of braids, waeves,nhair oil,hair treatments.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been running her business for seven years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, her previous loan is being successfully repaid. She wants to increase sales to gain more. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Lindo Tecpan Group

texts.es: Dúo lindo tecpan, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Magdalena de 22 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de Laurel desde hace 2 años, es un negocio mur rentable ya que por la demanda que tiene en el area es muy vendible, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor en laurel, esperando que le puedan ayudar nuevamente con el credito solicitado, ella es su segundo credito que solicita y a pagado muy puntual.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena is 22 years old and is one of the members of the "Dúo Lindo Tecpan" group. She has been selling laurel for the past two years. It is very profitable as there is high demand in her area. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, laurel,  wholesale. She hopes you can help her with this new loan. It is her second loan and she promises to pay it on time.

loans.use: to buy laurel ot sell.

loans.name: Nestry

texts.en:
Nestry is a 27-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with a ready market and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a boutique. 

This is her second loan with SMEP-DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 50-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 15 to 28 years. She describes herself to be confident. She operates a farm where she grows collard greens. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with a favorable market and her primary customers are small-scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests and diseases that affect her crops. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Antonia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a  woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur; Myra is 22 years old and has children who are in school.

Myra has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. 

Myra requested a PHP 6,000 bridge loan through NWTF to  purchase additional feed for her business to restart her business activities.

Myra has been in this business for a year, and would like to rebuild it with your help.  

In the future, Myra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 40, is married living with her family in a village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has six children. For the last twenty-four years, Chantha and her husband have been farming rice as a main source of the family’s income to make a living. Together, they can earn about US$14 per day from the current business. 

Chantha has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans. The past loans which she successfully repaid have helped her support her family with sufficient foods. Now she is asking for a loan. Chantha wants to buy wedding supplies for celebrating her daughter’s wedding. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough supplies for this wedding.

loans.use: to buy wedding supplies for celebrating her daughter’s wedding

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ont's Group

texts.en:
Ont is 44 years old, living with her family members in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband earn a living through growing cassava. Having been in this business for 26 years, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
Ont has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ont is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es Daniela, pensando en las opciones laborales que quiere tener al terminar la carrera y viendo la cantidad de administradores, ingenieros, médicos entres otras muchas profesiones que hoy en día se encuentran estancadas, ella se da cuenta que muchas veces la gente termina los estudiosos y después le hes muy complicado conseguir empleo y ganando salarios que no compensan la inversión realizada, en las diferentes facultades y el tiempo que se gasta para ser una persona mas preparada  para los retos que hay hoy en día, para lograr una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que mi persona, Daniela  ha decidido iniciar  por una profesión que siente que nació con ella, es algo que desde la niñez y la humildad el haber perdido al padre a los cinco años de edad. 
Desde la madre, la hermana, las tías y hasta la abuela por falta de recursos económicos, han tenido entre ellas  mismas  que compartir desde el arreglo de las uñas hasta el arreglo del cabello y viendo como la madre se sacrificaba todos los días para darle lo mejor a la hermana y a ella, Por eso quiere  un mejor futuro para la  familia y para ella, por eso ha decido estudiar una carrera para alcanzar todas las metas 
Es por eso que decidido comentarles la situación, porque el convenio de kiva le  ayudaría, ya que ha esta corta edad tiene un hijo de dos años y medio, el se llama Kevin Andrés y pues ese descuento le serviría para los gastos relacionados  al curso de cosmetología y estética integral. 
Escogió  esta carrera porque le gusta todo lo relacionado con el cuidado de la piel y la imagen, aprender muchas cosas sobre el cuidado como las mascarillas, los masajes, la imagen, los peinados, el maquillaje y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
This is Daniela. She is thinking about career options that she wants to have at the end of her schooling. She has seen how administration, engineering, medicine, and many other professions have become stagnant nowadays. She has realized that many times people finish their studies and later it is hard for them to obtain employment or earn salaries that don't make up for the investment they have made in their education and the time they have put into becoming better prepared for today's challenges. 

So without hesitation, in order to achieve a better quality of life, Daniela has decided to start a career that she feels has been inside her ever since she was little. Because of limited resources, her mother, her sister, her aunts, and even her grandmother, always fixed their own and each other's nails and hair, and Daniela likes everything that has to do with skin care and image. She has chosen this as a career and wants to learn about treatments like facials, massages, hairstyling, makeup, and many other things. 

Daniela lost her father when she was five, and after seeing how much her mother sacrificed in order to provide for her and her sister, she wants a better future for her family and for herself and has decided to get a cosmetology degree in order to achieve all of her goals. That is why she decided to talk about her situation and seek help through Kiva, since even though she is young she has a two-and-a-half-year-old son. His name is Kevin Andrés. 

She will use the loan to help pay for courses in cosmetology and beauty.

loans.use: to pay one semester's tuition.

loans.name: Shaista's Group

texts.en:
Shaista is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. She has knitted handmade embroidery at her home for the past eight years. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw that has irregularities.  He is an irresponsible husband and does not care about his children. She has proven herself to be a responsible and brave mother.  During the last eight years, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Shaista requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase cut pieces, needle, stone, stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colors.

She does not want loose heart and wants to afford all her household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.
She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cut pieces, needle, stones, stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: San Martin De Tours Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Asunta Eudiz ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia también vende lechones (es un plato a base de carne de chancho al horno) los días sábados y domingos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS” communal bank which is located in Huarocondo district, part of Anta Province, Department of Cusco. 

Asunta Eudiz is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. She works in her business, a grocery store, selling basic goods like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She also sell lechones ( a roast pig based food) on Saturday and Sunday. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. She has had this business for 8 years and things are going well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar oil and rice.

The members who appear in the inserts arrived at the meeting late for work reasons. The other members sell pigs, sell animals, run a grocery store, and own a restaurant. The members thank those who form part of this dream and promise to pay the installments of the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sophat is 40 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about US$10 per day and can save about US$5 each day for future needs. 

This is Sophat’s first loan with VisionFund. 

Now she is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Dúo Sinai Group

texts.es:
DÚO SINAI
 Este dúo lo forma Wendy Roció, quien tiene 1 hijo, y es soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración del pan junto con su papa, quien es el dueño de la panadería, pero ella hace los panes grandes, ahora quiere comenzar a vender pastelitos y pasteles y para eso esta solicitando el capital porque necesita muchos moldes y utensilios para elaborarlos y no los tiene también quiere comprar leña e ingredientes para hacer lo que le están pidiendo en la panadería, su padre ya esta grande y no puede hacerlo entonces ella quiere comenzar para que la panadería sigua complaciendo a la cliente.
texts.en: Wendy Rocio is a member of Dúo Sinia. She has one child and is single.  She makes bread along with her dad.  He owns the bakery but she makes the large breads.  Now she wants to start selling pastries and cakes.  To do this, she is requesting some capital because she needs a lot of pans and utensils which she doesn't have in order to make them.  She also wants to buy firewood and ingredients to meet demand at the bakery.  Her father is old and he can't do it, so she wants to start so that the bakery can continue to please its customers.

loans.use: to buy bakery inputs

loans.name: Ganthan Shg Group

texts.en:
Gandunlu, who is shown with her hand raised, is the featured profile member of Ganthan Shg Group. She lives in Bishnupur, which is 25 kms away from the city of Imphal, in the northeastern region of India.
