During this time, she has grown to be greatly respected and beloved among her colleagues and students that she teaches. She says that she is really happy to teach and to lead children in a way that they will be educated, kind and clever people who may become very useful and important people in society. 

Anzhela is married and has a nice daughter. Her daughter is a student, studying to be a psychologist. Anzhela’s husband is a driver. Both of them try to do their best in order to provide their only daughter with good living conditions. Anzhela decided to surprise her daughter and her husband. She asks for a loan of 300,000 AMD in order to buy living room furniture for her flat. She is sure that they will like her idea of making their flat more comfortable and nice.

loans.use: to buy living room furniture

loans.name: Eilen Yadira

texts.es: Eilen es una mujer de 27 años dedicada a la venta de mercancía por catálogo (productos de belleza y de hogar), quien pretende invertir el crédito en más surtido, para ganar unos premios y descuentos por pedidos más grandes. Eilen sueña con incrementar sus ingresos y poder darle lo mejor a su hijo de dos años, además comprar una casa para su madre, en la que pueda vivir tranquilamente sin preocuparse por fechas de pago de arriendo.
texts.en:
Eilen, 27, makes catalogue sales of beauty products and home products.  She plans to invest the loan in more merchandise to win some prizes and discounts by ordering large quantities.

Eilen dreams of increasing her income and being able to give her two-year-old son the best.  She also wants to buy a house for her mother so she can live peacefully without worrying about paying the rent.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and home products

loans.name: Hernan Leandro

texts.es: Hernan es un hombre de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos  hijos de 4 y 6 años y se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, Él es un señor  dedicado a su trabajo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para cultivar papas. Hernan comenta que a sus plantas les trabaja con mucho cuidado y que para esto contrata a 3 personas para que le ayuden, también  dice que su esposa es de gran apoyo para él ya que lo colabora en todo lo que realiza. Su mayor anhelo es hacer una buena cosecha para pagar puntual su crédito y con las ganancias que le queden le gustaría comprar una casa para su familia y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Hernan, 28, lives with his wife and two children of 4 and 6 years of age.  Both his children are attending school.  He is very dedicated to his work.  

He is going to use this loan to invest in material to grow potatoes.  Hernan tells us that he looks after his crops well, hiring three people to help him do this.  He also tells us that his wife provides great support as she helps with all that he does. 
 
His greatest desire is to grow a good harvest to be able to pay off his loan and with the profits he would like to buy a house for his family and make sure that his children keep studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Richard Abelardo

texts.es: Con 19 años de edad Richard es un hombre soltero que vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, él es un joven emprendedor que se dedica hace un año a la ganadería y anteriormente estaba asistiendo al colegio, él se encuentra asistiendo al curso de choferes profesionales,  Richard  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca. El joven es muy trabajador y con este negocio aspira obtener ingresos y  para pagar el costo de la licencia de conducir autos y poder ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
At 19, Richard is a single adult who lives with his parents and his brothers and sisters.  This young entrepreneur has dedicated himself to raising livestock for the last year, since he left school.  At the moment, he is also going to a driving school for professional chauffeurs.  

Richard is going to invest the money in a cow.  He is very hard working and he hopes that this business will provide him with enough income to pay for the driving license and to start university.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora was born in 1990. She is not married and she lives with her parents. 

She always wanted to organize her own business. With this aim she took part in a competition, ‘The Best Business Plan,’ organized by the Association of Business Women. 

She wrote her business plan. She is going to open a dry cleaning business. She must repair the site of her dry-cleaning business. Sayora’s workshop is located in the center of her town. She hopes that her business will go well. 

Sayora is asking for a loan of  USD 1,500 to repair the site of her workshop to organize her new business. She hopes that this business will bring her happiness.

loans.use: To repair the site of her workshop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 28 years old and her four children are in school.

Jocelyn has a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, fruits, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, fruits, rice and sugar

loans.name: Amor Paz Y Bendición Group

texts.es:
La señora Elena Marcelina es casada. De 52 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 2 hijos y los 2 están estudiando. Se dedica a tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio con poca mercadería y a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de artículos de consumo diario. En el futuro desea tener una abarroteria en la localidad.

Las demás integrates del grupo se dedican a artesanía y sastrería.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena Marcelina is married and is 52 years old. She did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has two children and both of them are students. She runs a store selling basic household items. She started this business with a small inventory and today marks her sixth year of experience.

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase items that are consumed every day. In the future she wants to have a grocery store in the neighborhood. 

The other members of the group make a living from handicrafts and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase daily consumption items.

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат мама четверых детей. Ее сыновья работают и живут за границей. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается земледелием, он выращивает сельскохозяйственный культуры на земельном участке. Зумрат помогает и поддерживает мужа во всем в том числе и в его работе. Дополнительно Зумрат в коровнике держит бычков. Она любит животных и хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность. Зумрат сама научилась ухаживать, кормить и поить скотин. Она хочет на деньги от кредита купить маленьких телят и тем самым увеличить количество скотин. Ей не хватает определенной суммы денег, чтобы совершить покупку. По этой причине она просит ей помочь.
texts.en: Zumrat is a mother to four children. Her sons work and live abroad. She is 50 years old and is married. Her husband practices crop farming. He grows crops on their plot of land. Zumrat helps and supports her husband with his work. Additionally, Zumrat houses bull calves in her barn. She loves animals and wants to expand her cattle breeding business. Zumrat learned all by herself how to take care of, feed and water cattle. She wants to use the money from the loan to buy small calves, thereby increasing the size of her herd. She does not have the necessary money to make this purchase. This is why she is asking for help.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos,medias entre otras ropas, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y loa vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Apu Curi communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Urcos, part of the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.  

Mercedes is one of the members.  She is 43, lives with her life partner, and has eight children.  Mercedes works selling clothing.  She sells sweaters, pants, t-shirts, tights, and other clothing items.  She also has a business selling guinea pigs which she raises and fattens to sell in different markets.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., selling in different places such as institutions or to her friends.  She has been in this line of work for eight years and she is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell clothes.  She requests the loan to buy sweaters, tights, t-shirts, pants, and jackets.  

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo asked permission to have their pictures taken after the meeting for work-related reasons.

Other members' businesses include selling pigs, selling animals, grocery store, and restaurant.  

Mercedes thanks those who take part in this dream via this medium, and promises to make payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, tights, t-shirts, pants, and jackets

loans.name: Maercy

texts.en:
Maercy is a married woman with three children attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past four years, Maercy has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES Maercy wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed, pesticides, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Paul Bryan

texts.en:
Paul Bryan is a young married entrepreneur who runs a general store in their village to make a living. For more than ten years, he earns well with the help and support of his wife to provide for the family.  He needs to buy additional grocery goods in order to increase sales.  With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan was realized. 

In the future, Paul Bryan wants to acquire a new motorcycle unit to be used for the business in purchasing and carrying stock. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods

loans.name: Dúo Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Esperanza este grupo esta conformado por la señora Mayra Alejandra de 22 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas los tres tiempos, esta muy contenta porque por medio de este negocio ella a podido salir adelante con su familia, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz por mayor ya que nececita tener mas capital para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Esperanza” (Hope) includes Sra. Mayra Alejandra. She is 22 years old and has been selling tortillas for three seasons. Mayra is very pleased because her business has enabled her family to get ahead.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy corn in bulk. Mayra needs more capital so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Ana de 34 años de edad es una mujer muy humilde y muy trabajadora quien no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a los escasos recursos económicos que sus padres presentaban en su niñez ya que su economía depende únicamente de los ingresos de la agricultura los cuales no eran los suficientes para ayudarle con sus estudios. Doña Ana es madre soltera de tres hijos la mayor de 16 años y curso hasta sexto grado, el segundo de 14 y curso hasta segundo grado y el ultimo de 7 años que está en segundo grado los cuales viven como una gran familia y juntos se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de café viviendo en su casa de habitación sus padres también. Sus cultivos de café son trabajados desde hace más de 8 años los cuales son una herencia de sus padres ubicados a 500 metros de distancia desde su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada caminando en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su padre. 
Sus planes como productora de café seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos de café, esforzarse por comprar más áreas de terreno para seguir cultivando siendo su sueño como madre ver a sus hijos en una mejor condición de vida con un patrimonio fortalecido para que puedan trabajar ya que no pudieron prepararse en sus estudios. Hoy en día Doña Ana solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros que son necesarios para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café en esta temporada y así tener una mejor producción de café. Esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA  ya que mejorara su calidad de vida y el mantenimiento de su cultivo.
texts.en:
34-year-old Sonia is a very humble and hard-working woman who did not have the opportunity to study due to the scant finances of her parents when she was little, since their only income was from agriculture and it was not enough to help her with her studies. Sonia is a single mother; she has three children: the oldest (a daughter) is 16 years old and has finished sixth grade, the second (a son) is 14 years old and has finished second grade, and the youngest (a son) is seven years old and is in the second grade. They live as one big family and they work together in agriculture. They grow coffee and her parents live with them as well. She has been working with her coffee crops for eight years. She inherited them from her parents and they are located 500 metres away from her home. She walks there with her three children and her father.

Her plans as a coffee producer are to continue investing in her coffee crops and to buy more land so she can continue growing coffee. Her dream as a mother is to see her children in better living conditions with property so that they can work, since she was not able to support them further in their studies. Ana is requesting financial support in order to purchase fertiliser, compost, and foliar fertiliser, which are necessary for maintaining her coffee crops in this season so she can have greater coffee production. She is hoping to be supported by the different investors on the Kiva platform so that she can improve her quality of life and her crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Munisa

texts.ru: Муниса жизнерадостная и веселая жительница маленького района Шахритус. Она семейный человек. Ранее она занималась земледелием. Сейчас она поставила перед собой цель начать свой бизнес. У нее дома есть пару скотин. Она с юного возраста ухаживала за скотами, кормила и поила их. Муниса решила все свои навыки и опыт вложить в бизнес животноводства. Только Мунисе не хватает достаточной суммы денег, чтобы купить достаточное количество телят и начать бизнес, который изменит ее жизнь к лучшему принося прибыль. Она надеется с новым источником дохода, у нее будет новые экономические возможности. Поддержите Мунису.
texts.en: Munisa is a happy and cheerful resident of the tiny Shahrituz District. She is a family person. Previously, she practiced crop farming. Now she has set the goal for herself of starting her own business. She has a pair of cattle at her house. From a young age, she has been looking after cattle, feeding and watering them. Munisa decided to put all of her skills and experience into the business of livestock breeding. Only Munisa does not have sufficient funds to buy enough calves and start her business. This business will change her life for the better by bringing in a profit. She relies on this new source of income, which will give her new economic opportunities. Please support Munisa.

loans.use: To buy calves to start her new business.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 25 y 18 años de edad y sus dos hijas de 15 y 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo desde hace más de 10 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y dentro de su vivienda. Gracias a su carisma muchas personas prefieren sus productos y cada día son más las personas que demandan sus ricos tamales. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (pollo, condimentos, especies, aceite, maíz, hojas de banano, etc.) para la elaboración y venta de los deliciosos tamales que tanto demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: María is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner, her two sons aged 18 and 25, and her two daughters aged 12 and 15. She has made and sold chicken tamales for more than 10 years. She sells them as a street vendor and inside her home. Thanks to her charisma, many people prefer her products, and every day there are more people who ask for her delicious tamales. With the goal of improving her and her family's living conditions, she has made the decision to ask FUSAI for this loan to buy necessary supplies (chicken, condiments, spices, oil, corn, banana leaves, etc.) in order to make and sell the delicious tamales her customers ask for so much.

loans.use: to buy chicken, condiments, spices, oil, corn, banana leaves, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets and poles to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Marisela Beatriz

texts.es: Marisela tiene 22 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.  Marisela y su compañero de vida trabajan muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su hijo lo necesario. Desde hace mas de dos años Marisela se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como: yuca frita, atoles, pasteles de carne, enchiladas y fruta preparada. Este negocio es el que le permite apoyar con la economía del hogar y les permite ajustar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Marisela solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de fruta, yuca, verduras, aceite y otros insumos necesarios para preparar los antojitos típicos que tanto demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Marisela is 22 years old; she lives in her own home with her partner and her two-year-old son. Marisela and her partner work very hard to provide all the necessities for their household and child. For the past two years, Marisela has worked at selling typical snacks such as fried yucca, atole (a hot, grain-based beverage), meat pies, enchiladas, and prepared fruits. This business helps her support her family and cover her household expenses. Marisela is requesting this loan from FUSAI which she will invest in the business by buying a variety of fruits and vegetables, yucca, oil, and other necessary ingredients to prepare the typical foods that her customers demand.

loans.use: prepare and sell traditional snacks.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 16 años y su hijo de 15 años de edad. Con la necesidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia Yesia comenzó hace 5 años el negocio de venta de verduras como: papas , zanahorias, pepinos, tomates, cebollas, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Yesenia desea invertir en su negocio  ya que es lo que le permite ganarse la vida y dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de verduras (zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, papas,etc.) para la venta y así poder  incrementar las ventas lo cual le permita mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her 16 year old daughter and 15 year old son.

In order to improve her living conditions and those of her family, Yesenia started the business five years ago of selling vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, etc. She is a street vendor and this is how she supports her household. Yesenia wants to invest in her business as it is what permits her to make a living and give her children what they need.

Therefore, she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of assorted vegetables (carrots, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc.) to sell and thus increase her sales which will permit her to improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida  y su pequeño hijo de 11 años de edad. María trabaja como empleada doméstico desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto a su compañero de vida llevan el sustento a su hogar y dan a su hijo lo necesario. María desea construir un muro  perimetral que le permita brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava. De esta forma espera ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and lives in a house she owns with her life companion and her young 11 year old son. She has been employed as a domestic worker for a long time. She, together with her life companion, are able to put food on the table and give their son what he needs. 

Maria wants to build a perimeter wall that will enable her to provide her family with greater security. Consequently she is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can purchase bricks, cement, sand and  gravel. In this way she hopes to continue improving her living conditions and that of her dear family.

loans.use: to buy beicks, cement, sand and gravel to build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Mirian Dinora

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a su mamá, cuenta con un empleo en una  empresa ubicado en su comunidad de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Doña Mirian se desempeña como cajera y mesera desde hace mas de 6 años. Necesita el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa intima como blúmeres, braseares, pantis, etc. para ofrecerles, dichos productos a sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos de su comunidad, desea emprender este negocio ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vidad de su familia. 
Doña Mirian espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que con el emprenderá una actividad económica que vendrá a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así podrá cumplir sus sueños,  como el de ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas preparadas y de bien.  Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014
texts.en:
Mirian is a hard-working, responsible person who lives in a community in northern Honduras with her mother.  She works at a company in the community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Mirian has been working as a waitress and cashier for six years.  She is in need of a loan to buy lingerie to sell to co-workers and neighbors in her community.  She wants to start the business to earn more income for a better quality of life for her family. 

Mirian hopes the loan will be of much help because she will be able to start her sales activity and improve her family's lifestyle so they can realize their dreams.  She also wants to see her children become good citizens and get training.  By earning more income the family will live better.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - February, 2014

loans.use: To buy lingerie for her business.

loans.name: Juana Leticia

texts.es: Juana de 19 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ellos viven en una casa construida de bambú la que está en muy malas condiciones. Juana desde hace dos años en apoyo a su compañero en el gasto de alimentación de su hijo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Juana quiere que su hijo vaya creciendo en un ambiente diferente. Por lo anterior está decidida a cambiar las paredes de su vivienda por lámina galvanizada y cuartón de madera de pino para la estructura de soporte. Juana no tiene la totalidad de la inversión para la mejora, por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI y comprar todos los materiales necesarios como lo son; lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera para la estructura y otros. Juana está consiente del compromiso que esto implica pero menciona que dejará las puertas abiertas, así solicitar más adelante otros créditos orientado a la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana, 19, lives with her common-law husband and their two-year-old son.  They live in a bamboo house that is in poor condition.  For several years Juana has been helping her husband cover household expenses and she works selling fruit and vegetables.

Juana wants her son to grow up in a different environment so she wants to change the walls of her house to metal sheeting on a wood structure.  She does not have enough money to cover the full investment and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy the necessary materials: metal sheeting, nails, wood beams, etc.  She is aware of the commitment this entails and wants to leave the door open for future loans to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, nails and pinewood beams to put up walls on her house.

loans.name: Familia T´siseje Group

texts.es: Familia T’Siseje está conformado por tres integrantes todos son familiares, ellos viven en una comunidad Mazahua la mayoría de las personas aun hablan su lengua materna y todos son personas muy amables. Doña Refugio es la representante del grupo y platica que el nombre lo eligió ella misma porque T’ Siseje significa estrellita en Mazahua. Ella tiene 52 años de edad está casada con el señor Concepción desde hace varios años ya no tienen ningún dependiente. Los tres integrantes del grupo son Nancy, Concepción y Doña Refugio ellos invierten su crédito en la renta de sus placas de sus taxis o en lo que los taxis vallan necesitando. Hace poco iniciaron con su negocio: Doña Refugio anteriormente tenía un taller pero desafortunadamente tuvo que dejarla porque tiene otras actividades y su esposo siempre ha trabajado en el taxi por eso ella decidió invertir en la renta de las placas porque sabe que es un buen negocio y tiene buenas ganancias, la única dificultad que presentan es su negocio es cuando no les llega puntualmente el pago de la renta de sus taxis. Los tres integrantes están muy contentos y agradecidos con KIVA y Vision Fund por el crédito autorizado porque con los créditos podrán realizar sus sueños que es dejar de pedir crédito en las microfinancieras y poder colar sus dos locales para iniciar con un nuevo negocio.
texts.en: Familia T’Siseje is made up of three members who are related. They live in the community of Mazahua. The majority of the people still speak their maternal language, and all the people are very friendly. Ms. Refugio is the group's representative and says that she chose the name herself because T’ Siseje means little star in Mazahua. Ms. Refugio is 52 years old and has been married to Mr. Concepción for many years. They no longer have any dependent children. The group's three members are Nancy, Concepción and Refugio. They will invest the loan in the fees for plates for their taxis or in whatever the taxis need. They started their business a short time ago: Ms. Refugio previously had a workshop, but unfortunately, she had to leave it because she had other activities. Her husband has always worked in taxis, so Ms. Refugio decided to invest in the fee for plates because she knows it is a good business and has good earnings. The only difficulty they face in their business is when the payment for their taxi fees is not on time. The three members are content and grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for the authorized loan. With the loans, they will be able to achieve their dreams: to stop requesting loans from microfinancers and to be able to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy plates, spare parts, tires, etc. for cars.

loans.name: Zochilt Guadalupe

texts.es:
Zochilt tiene 30 años de edad, logró culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a manejar una moto-taxi en el municipio donde ellos residen, como fruto de su matrimonio han procreado 3 hijos los cuales dos  están estudiando y el otro pasa con ella en casa ya que está muy pequeño para ir a la escuela, por lo tanto solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Los oficios domésticos, es la actividad a la cual Zochilt se dedica, ella solo cuida a sus hijos ya que el esposo trabaja durante todo el día, esta mujer trabajadora ya tiene alrededor de un mes de haber iniciado una pequeña tienda en el lugar donde ella vive, tomó la iniciativa ya que la dueña del moto-taxi que maneja su esposo, la motivó para que abriera la tienda, Zochilt ha visto que el negocio es bueno ya que en la colonia donde ella vive no hay tiendas cercanas, y por lo tanto ahora está facilitando a las demás personas que puedan comprar en un lugar cercano, y además ella obtiene ingresos económicos para su familia. Solo ella se dedica a esta actividad pues nadie mas de su familia se involucra, y porque además el esposo llega tarde de su trabajo y no puede ayudarle con la tienda, por lo tanto entre los dos mantienen el hogar.

Zochilt está solicitando este crédito, para comprar gaseosas, churros, dulces y galletas, ya que son productos que los niños buscan, pero también ella desea poner a la venta productos de la canasta básica como aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, etc.
 
El sueños de Zochilt es seguir con su negocio pues desde muy pequeña le ha gustado esta actividad y confía en la oportunidad que le brindan los préstamos, además desea superarse y sacar adelante a su familia  y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa para que juntos puedan darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar y que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Zochilt is 30 years old, and she has completed high school. She is married and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi in the municipality where they live. They have three children, two of whom are attending school, and the other child, who is not yet school-age, stays at home with her. Her children are the only ones depending on her. She is a housewife, and she takes care of their children, as her husband works during the day.  

About a month ago, this hardworking woman opened a little store in her home, encouraged to take the initiative by the woman who owns the motorcycle taxi that her husband drives. Zochilt has noticed that the business is good, as in her neighborhood there are no other stores nearby. Therefore, she is making it easier for people to do their shopping closer to home.  Also, she is earning income for her family.  She is the only one carrying out this activity. No one else in the family is involved, as her husband does not come home from work until later, and cannot help her with the store.  Thus, between the two of them, they maintain their home. 

Zochilt is requesting this loan in order to purchase soda pop, churros, sweets, and cookies, as they are the products that children want; but she also wants to sell basic food items such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, etc. 

Zochilt’s dreams are to continue with her business, as she has liked this occupation since she was young; and she is counting on the opportunity that the lenders are giving her.  Also, she wants to succeed, and provide for her family.  She wants to help her husband with the household expenses so that together they can give their children the opportunity to study and become great professionals.

loans.use: to purchase soda pop, churros, sweets, cookies, oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, and stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover costs of higher education.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.en:
Jorge has always dreamt of becoming an accountant. He was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now with the chance to achieve his dream, he is concerned about affording tuition fees. He expects to graduate soon but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Jorge shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a Vittana loan, Jorge plans on using the funds to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part time job. Jorge currently works as a cashier to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.en:
Carmen has always dreamed of becoming an agricultural engineer. Carmen is currently attending the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, working towards her degree in agricultural engineering. She expects to graduate in October 2014 but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Carmen shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a Vittana loan, Carmen plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Potosi. With a career in agricultural engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Carmen's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family, finances have always been tight. With seven older siblings, Carmen is unsure how she will be able to afford her graduation fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Carmen is married with her own child but this has not stopped her from pursing her dreams. With a professional degree and a career in agricultural engineering, she will be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizer, urea, and Nutricafe in order to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.en:
Carlos has always dreamt of becoming a veterinarian. He is currently attending the Universidad Pública de El Alto, working towards his degree in veterinary medicine. He expects to graduate in February 2017, but without a loan, he is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Carlos shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a Vittana loan, Carlos plans to pay for his tuition. 

With two older siblings, Carlos is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly appreciates Kiva for their financial support that enabled her to boost her tailoring business and earn extra income.

Besides the tailoring business, Dzine sells charcoal. She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 34-year-old man with a wife working in a nearby trading center.

Godfrey runs a farm supply shop at Sanje town, something he has done for six years. Through this business, Godfrey is proud to have gained a lot of possessions from this business. For example, the security pledged to the institution, he says, came from his savings from this business.

In addition to a farm supply business, Godfrey is also involved in agriculture, something he does to supplement his income. 

According to Godfrey, part of this loan is being used to purchase more stock to sell and part of it is being used to supplement his agriculture business. Godfrey is described as a hard working young man, a trait he says enables him to deal with his business associates with ease.

Godfrey appreciates the decision by Ugafode to give him this loan and hopes he will achieve a lot from it. He is hard working and thanks the Kiva lenders for partnering with him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Abduhayot

texts.ru:
Абдухаёт жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Абдухаёт много лет был мигрантом в России. Там он находился долгое время, чтобы заработать деньги для своей семьи. В итоге он смог построить на заработанные деньги небольшой домик для своей семьи. Затем он стал искать работу здесь у себя в посёлке, но так и не нашёл. Потом он решил начать свой бизнес. Абдухаёт обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Абдухаёт занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает ему в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Абдухаёт хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Абдухаёт очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduhayot is a cheerful and hardworking 43-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Abduhayot was a labor migrant in Russia for many years. He would live there for a long period of time in order to earn money for his family. As a result, he was able to use his earned money to build a small house for his family. He then began to look for work here in his village, but he did not find any. Then decided to start his own business. Abduhayot turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was an opportunity to receive financial assistance.

In order to have earnings to live on, Abduhayot has his own business. He practices fattening up and reselling cattle. He receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with this business. She sells the milk obtained from the cows. Now Abduhayot wants to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why he is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Abduhayot really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka, 27 years old, is a young woman from the village of Choga. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law. Maka's husband works in construction at a private company and generates 300 GEL monthly. To take care of her family's increased needs, the borrower is extensively engaged in agricultural activity, particularly cattle and milk-cow breeding, and in cultivating a plot of agricultural land, where nuts and kiwi are grown. She sells agricultural products locally and gets a daily income. She requested a loan of 500 GEL to begin trading used clothing. She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers.  This will give her a chance to earn more income and become financially independent. Regarding the Start Up program, Maka will be able to save and provide better future for her family.

loans.use: To start a trading business with used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as cloth, thread, buttons, and needles.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira was born in 1972. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. He grows potatoes. Six months ago, Zamira began her own business in animal husbandry because she needed to earn money. Zamira now wants to develop her new business. Zamira took part in the course called ‘To get Ahead’ from a women's organization and earned a certificate. Zamira is going to buy two cows to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old and married with six children.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and install a large iron door.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with six children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and her general store.

Alicia aspires to save money for the secure future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Filiz Çankaya

texts.en:
Filiz is married with one child.  The young entrepreneur works with ceramics.  She has a small workplace where she sells and makes her products.  She wants to expand her store and workshop.  She aims to buy a machine for her workshop.  She would like to make original designs.  She also wants to work with an interior designer to work on the building’s interior and exterior layout.  She wants to work with countries that value ceramic art.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Filiz Hanım, evli bir çocuğu var .  Genç girişimci seramik işiyle uğraşıyor.  Küçük bir iş yeri var hem satış hem de üretim yapıyor.  Dükkanını ve atölyesini büyütmek istiyor.  Atölye çalışmaları için makine almayı hedefliyor.  Özel tasarımlar yapmak istiyor.  İc mimarlarla çalışarak bina iç ve dış tasarım işleri yapmak istiyor.  Seramik sanatlarının değerini anlayan bilen ülkelerle de çalışmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Oyimniso

texts.en:
Oyimniso was born in 1957. She is a hardworking woman. Oyimniso lives with her family in a village. She has brought up 4 children. She is a careful mother of her children. 

She has always wanted to have her own business. She realized her dream 6 months ago. She organized her business of animal husbandry. She feeds cows and sells milk and milk products to local people. She is going to develop her business. She took part in a course through a women's organization called ‘To Get Ahead’ and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoji to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living with a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Al- Anwar2 Group

texts.en:
Al- Anwar2 is a group that consists of three women living in Hodiedah, Yemen. All the members of this group are from poor families. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Gadreiah is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of three children, living with them in a small room. Her oldest son is 11 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. She is the leader of the group. She is a Secondary school graduate. Gadreiah is very vigorous and works hard, and due to the low income of her husband, she decided to help him in his work through selling ice cream to the children in the street. 

She started up her business under the sunshine three years ago, but the income of this small business is very weak, and most of what she earns goes to cover the family's living expenses. For this reason, she decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ice cream products. She looks forward to opening a small grocery and providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream products for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of bamboo to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en:
Madiha is a 54-year-old widowed mother of three children. Six months ago she established her own small restaurant to make sure that she could provide her family with living necessities since her husband passed away leaving her as the sole breadwinner to her beloved children.

She is a Palestinian refugee who has lived and worked in a Palestinian Camp since she was born. She is working hard to improve her family's living and will try her best to move her business and the family's living outside the camp in the future.

Today Madiha is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to expand her newly established business through adding the new machines necessary to diversify her production and introduce her customers to highly requested new recipes.

Madiha is very anxious about this loan, since she is very sure that she will succeed in this domain because of her special talent and long experience in the cooking sector.

loans.use: To expand her newly established business through adding the new machines necessary to diversify her production and introduce her customers to new recipes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 23 years now and earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José, un campesino de 36 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace muchos años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y familiares desde que era pequeño, pues ha sido una tradición familiar y una alternativa para ganarse la vida.
Actualmente posee cultivos de papa y además tiene 3 terneras en gestación, esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y llevar el sustento diario a su esposa y sus 4 hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 5000 matas de hortensias, abonos y cancelará el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá incursionar en otro mercado, con el fin de complementar los ingresos y así estará en la capacidad económica para continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia.
José sueña con lograr que sus cultivos de hortensias le permitan mejorar la rentabilidad de sus negocios, así podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica a su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y disfrutar en familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, a 36-year-old farmer, has worked in agriculture and livestock-raising for many years.  He learned this occupation from his parents and relatives when he was very young, as it has been a family tradition and an opportunity for earning a living.

He currently has potato crops, and he also has three pregnant cows. This has allowed him to generate enough income to pay the basic household expenses, and to support his wife and four children. 

He will invest the loan that he is requesting in the purchase of 5,000 hydrangea plants and compost; and he will pay off his current loan balance. This will allow him to venture into another market in order to supplement his income. In this way, he will have the financial ability to continue providing for the welfare of his family.

José dreams of succeeding with his crop of hydrangeas, which will allow him to improve the profitability of his businesses. This way, he will be able to guarantee financial stability for his family, provide his children with a good education, and enjoy, along with his family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 5,000 hydrangea plants and compost, and to pay off his current loan balance.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 27-year-old single mother of one child who is five years old. She has two dependants who are her sisters. She owns a salon in Kyotera town and is more motivated by the fact that she is experienced in this field than any other and by the profitability of the business. She works for 7 days a week and 14 hours a day. She is also a farmer and specializes in animal rearing, which she started in 2008 and she is able to derive extra income for her survival. Her customers are from Kyotera town and neighboring areas.

She hopes to use the loan to buy a plot of land and boost her salon by equipping it with more supplies. She faces a challenge of people who ask for her services on credit and they refuse to pay, which is affecting her business.

She is described as an honest and hard working woman in business. She appreciates the lenders for the services offered to her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetices, weaves and relaxers and a plot of land

loans.name: Maksadzhon

texts.en: Maksadzhon is kind woman. She is a careful mother of four children. Her children (Manizha, Madina, Mahina and Mehrona) are non-adults. Her husband Ravshan is a builder. Maksadzhon wants to organize her own business because she needs to earn money. Maksadzhon is going to organize a business selling children's clothes in a local market. Maksadzhon took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes to start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a married woman with four school-going children. Anzazi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Anzazi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business and also sells goats, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, green vegetables and goats for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, green vegetables and goats for resale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

Besides the shop business, Sidi operates a cafe preparing various foods and selling to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy utensils and food ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat was born in 1954 and she is widowed. When her husband died, she began her business. She began her own business with animal husbandry. Muhabbat has great experience in this field. She feeds cows for some months and sells them in a local market where she has her regular customers. Muhabbat is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy feed for her cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 30 years old. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five. She owns a retail business which she has been running for the past six years. She requested a loan to buy more salt, cooking oil and sodas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more salt, cooking oil and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la construcción, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres están estudiando y el otro le ayuda en la agricultura, por lo tanto solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Marleni se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, este oficio lo aprendió sola ya que en la comunidad no hay muchas ventas de pollos y es algo que las personas busca bastante en los días festivos, el negocio lo tiene en la casa y este es el único trabaja al que ella se dedica, con los ingresos de este negocio va sacando adelante a sus hijos, ya que el esposo tuvo que emigrar a otro país pero está pendiente de ellos. 

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar 100 pollos y 4 quintales de concentrado y para ampliar la granja para tener más pollos.

Su sueño es tener una granja muy grande y con muchos pollos, y con las ganancias lograr una mejor calidad de vida con sus hijos, y darles la oportunidad de que estudien una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Marleni is 42 years old and went as far as third grade in school. Now she is married and her husband works in construction. She has four children, three of whom are going to school and the other helps her with the farming; only her children depend on her.

Marleni raises fattening chickens, work she has been doing for four years. She learned this occupation on her own. There is not much sale of chickens in the community, and it is something people look for quite a lot on festive occasions. 

She has the business in her home and this is the only work she does. With the income from the business she is raising her children. Her husband had to emigrate to another country, but is looking out for them.

She needs the loan requested from CrediCampo to buy 100 chickens and 400 pounds of feed concentrate, and to expand the chicken-raising operation to have more chickens. Her dream is to have a very large chicken-raising operation with many chickens, and with the earnings achieve a better quality of life for her and her children and give them the opportunity to study a professional career.

loans.use: To buy 100 chickens and 400 pounds of feed concentrate, and to expand her chicken-raising operation.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en: Shohista is 24 years old. She is married and has two children. Her children are little. Shohista is a business lady. She grows onions and tomatoes. Her husband helps her to manage the business. Shohista has her own land. She sells her harvest in a local market. Thanks to the high quality of her vegetables, she has regular customers. Now, her son is ill and in the hospital. She is asking for a loan to buy medicines for treating her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her son

loans.name: Mehroj

texts.en: Mehroj is a young and purposeful man. He is 21 years old. Mehroj is not married and lives with his parents. He is a student in the third course, studying at the Faculty of Finance and Credit. He studies well, and is one of the smart and successful students. In the future, he hopes to be a good specialist and work in a bank. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition, and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Gina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Caridad works hard to support her family.

Caridad has a bicycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Caridad is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle unit for her bicycle transportation business.

Caridad has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a divorced woman who has been blessed with two school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kwekwe has operated a charcoal and goat-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase charcoal and goats for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and goats for resale

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Lilibeth decided to engage in business to help her parents generate income. She is 26 years old and single. She runs a small variety store within her community selling grocery items, fruit and vegetables. 

With her desire to improve the business, Lilibeth is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of groceries, rice, fruit and vegetables to resell in her store. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries, rice, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a young and purposeful woman who was born in 1986. Gulnoza is divorced and is bringing up a little son. Gulnoza lives with her child, mother and brothers, and she has her own business. 

Gulnoza grows crops and vegetables such as potatoes and carrots. She has been busy with this business for more than five years. She developed her business little by little. 

Gulnoza must make a new sowing, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar nunca ha tenido energía eléctrica en su hogar ha vivido toda su vida en la oscuridad iluminándose con candiles candelas o phocos de baterías , nos comenta que el apenas logro estudiar hasta segundo grado pues la situación económica y que quedaba en ese tiempo la escuela muy retirada no le permitió continuar así que se puso  a trabajar con su padre. cumpliendo los 13 años fue reclutado por el servicio militar patriótico por cinco años durante la guerra civil en Nicaragua da gracias a Dios que pudo salir con vida , cuando regreso a su casa ya tenia 18 años así  que se dedico a la agricultura, en las tierras que su padre le dio sembraba café poco a poco aumento su productividad y compro mas tierras para así poder cultivar mas  hasta hoy en día ese es su medio para sobrevivir y mantener a su familia y que le genera mas ingreso  apesar de que también realiza otras actividades que le permiten recibir otros ingresos extras. El solicita un crédito para comprar un sistema solar sin duda dice cambiara la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar never had electricity in his home. He has lived his entire life in darkness except for the use of candles and battery-powered flashlights. Oscar says that he barely finished the second grade due to his financial situation at the time. Since he was not allowed to continue his schooling, Oscar’s father put him to work. When he turned 13, Oscar was drafted into military service and he served for five years during the Nicaraguan civil war. Thanks to God, he was able to come out alive.

When he returned home at the age of 18, Oscar devoted himself to farming. On the land given to him from his father, Oscar planted coffee and gradually increased his productivity. He bought more land and was able to cultivate to the level he has reached today. This enables him to support and sustain his family. Oscar engages in other business activities to generate extra income.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a solar energy system. Without a doubt, this will change his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 30 ans 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de chaussure, d’habillement, et de balaie. Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chaussure en plastique. Elle compte acheter 30 paires de chaussures plastiques avec son argent chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie utiliser pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The Dembagnouma group is made up of married women. On average, they are 30 years old and have 4 children. They all live in large traditional families in the village of Nala II, Falaka commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborly and friendship ties. They run businesses selling vegetables for sauces, shoes, clothing, and brooms. The women of the Dembagnouma group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand of their clientele, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. These sums will be used to buy the merchandise discussed above. The client Kadia, the second person from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a plastic shoe saleswoman. She expects to buy 30 pairs of plastic shoes with the money at the wholesalers in Bamako. The sales will be made at retail and for cash from her home and in the village to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA which will be used in part to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DOSSOUMA, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de gâteau, du lait, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BENE la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers (étalagiste). Elle compte acheter, 1 sac de sucre, 1 carton de pâte alimentaires, 40 kg de riz, et des sachets plastiques au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, dans sa petite boutique, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans activité.
texts.en: The Djekafo group is made up of married women. On average, they are 38 years old and have 5 children. They all live in large traditional families in the village of Dossouma, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborly and friendship ties. They run businesses selling vegetables for sauces, grains, cakes, milk and various other items. The women of the Djekafo group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand of their clientele, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. These sums will be used to buy the merchandise discussed above. The client Bene, the second person from the right in the seated row, is illiterate. She is currently a saleswoman of various articles (window dresser). She expects to buy 1 bag of sugar, 1 box of pasta, 40 kilograms of rice, and plastic bags at the weekly market. Her sales will be made at retail prices for cash from her home, in her small shop, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various articles.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KASSIKE, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de chaussure, de charbon, de savon, du pain, et du lait. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIATOU la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chaussure en plastique. Elle compte acheter, 30 paires de chaussure pour Homme, et 15 paires de chaussures pour Femme chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women. On average, they are 36 years old and have 5 children. They all live in large traditional families in the village of Kassike, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through parentage, neighborly and friendship ties. They run businesses selling grains, shoes, coal, soap, bread and milk. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their first group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demand of their clientele, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso. These sums will be used to buy the merchandise discussed above. The client Kadiatou, the first person from the right in the seated row, is illiterate. She is currently a plastic shoe saleswoman. She expects to buy 30 pairs of plastic shoes for men and 15 pairs for women at the wholesalers in Bamako. The sales will be made at retail prices for cash from her home, and sometimes on foot, to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA which will be used to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KASSIKE, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de chaussure, de charbon, de savon, de tomate, d’habillement, de sucre, et de banane. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NIELE  première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de tomate. Elle compte acheter, 15 paniers de tomate chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au marché du village a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans le commerce de haricot
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of married women who on average are 36 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kassike in the Falako district, part of the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade condiments, shoes, coal, soap, tomatoes, clothing, sugar, and bananas. The Benkadi group of women are on their first group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. These loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

Group member Niele (the person sitting at the far right) is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of tomatoes and intends to buy 15 baskets of tomatoes from wholesalers at the weekly market. Retail sales are made for cash, from her home and at the village market, to a mixed clientele. 

She expects monthly profits of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be re-injected into the commerce of beans.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala I, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de chaussure, d’habillement, de henné, de galette, et de baigne. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MARIETOU la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de henné. Elle compte acheter, 2 paquets de sachet plastique, 5 sacs de feuille de henné séché sur place avec les paysans du village, elle les rend en poudre avant de les mettre sur le marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle composé uniquement de femme. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9. 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of married women who on average are 35 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala in the Falako district, part of the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell cereal, condiments, shoes, clothing, henna, cakes, and fritters. The Benkadi group of women are on their second group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

Group member Marietou (the second person kneeling from the right) is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of henna, and intends to buy two packs of plastic bags and five bags of dried henna leaves, bought locally from peasants in the village.

She pulverizes the henna into powder before bringing it to market. Retail sales are made for cash at her home and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, to customers consisting solely of women.

She expects monthly profits of 9,000 CFA francs, which will be injected into a goat-raising business.

loans.use: buy henna

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con sus dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, en el recinto la Floresta perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
María  se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, papas y a la crianza de cuyes, borregos y vacas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, y en la alimentación de los animales. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de papas. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos, la costumbre que más le gusta es la Semana Santa.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, married, and lives with her two children (ages 11 and 15) in the neighborhood of La Floresta, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

María is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes, but she also raises guinea pigs, sheep, and cows. She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and feed for her animals. Her purchases will be made in Guaranda. Her goal is to improve the sale of her animals and her production of potatoes. Her challenges include dealing with the weather and the pests that could attack her crops.

In her free time, María enjoys being with her children. The tradition she enjoys the most is Holy Week.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KASSIKE, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de charbon, de savon, d’habillement, du lait, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente HAINE  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de lait. Elle compte acheter, 80 litres de lait sur place avec les peuhls du village. La vente se fait en gros et en espèce chez elle, uniquement à ses clients venue de Marka coungo. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is comprised of married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families in the village of Kassike, in the town of Falako, in the Dioïla prefecture, and the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friendship. They sell condiments, cereals, charcoal, soap, clothing, milk, and various items. This is the first group loan for the women of the Kotognontala group. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clients, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client, Haine, seated second from the left, is illiterate. She sells milk, and would like buy 80 liters of milk from the Fula people (large migratory ethnic group of West Africa) in the village. She sells for wholesale prices and for cash out of her home, and only to her clients coming from Marka Coungo. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA that she'll use to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: buy milk.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
