Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala I, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce, de condiment, de chaussure, d’oignon, d’igname, d’habillement, de poisson fumé, et de galette. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ASSAN la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de balaie. Elle compte acheter 280 pièces de balaies chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au marché hebdomadaire à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is comprised of married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala I, in the town of Falako, in the Dioïla prefecture, and in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friendship. They work in restaurants and business. They sell condiments, shoes, onions, yams, clothing, smoked fish, and pancakes. This is the first group loan for the women of the Kotognontala group. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clients, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. These amounts will be used to buy the aforementioned goods. 

The client Assan, the woman standing all the way to the right, is illiterate. She currently sells brooms, and would like to buy 280 brooms from wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells at retail prices for cash, out of her home and in the weekly market, and to a mixed clientele. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA that she'll use to ensure the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy brooms

loans.name: Nacline

texts.en: Nacline is 28 years old. She is married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past six years. She has requested the loan to buy more potatoes, beans, and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child and she goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenge includes transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to increase her capital to serve more customers and to buy a plot of land and build her own house She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 41 years old and lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. Tamara lives with her husband, two sons and retired parents-in-law. For some time, Tamara worked as an accountant, but for the past 10 years, she has been running a business sewing and repairing clothes and curtains. All the materials for her occupation she buys from Yerevan once a month. She goes there with her husband in their car. Her husband works at the local post office as a driver. She has a lot of customers who like her way of working, her polite attitude and patience during her work.

Tamara is asking for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams since her car needs to be repaired urgently. Without her car, her expenses will be more than her income.

loans.use: to repair her car

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with four children who are 25, 23, 8 and 5 years old. She has owned a boutique in Kyotera town since 1992 and thus is highly experienced. She works for 6 days a week and 13 hours a day.

She is also a produce dealer and a counselor from which she derives additional income. She supplies her products to fellow traders in Kyotera and surrounding villages.

She hopes to use the loan to boost her boutique and produce businesses. She experiences a problem of customers who take a long time to clear their debts. She anticipates increased sales in the next few weeks.

She is described as an honest and hardworking woman in business who is committed to expanding her business and increasing her partnership with Kiva lenders and Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Al-Shima2 Group

texts.en:
Al-Shima2 is a group consisting of three women and a man, living in Hodeida, Yemen.  All the members of the group are from poor families. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Iziah is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The oldest child is eleven years old and the youngest is seven, living with them in Hodeidah, Yemen. Iziah is the leader of the group, and she is an educated woman from a poor family. Two years ago she started up a business selling clothes to help her husband with their family expenses. She is a door-to-door seller. She is making modest profits, but she has found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy more clothes because most of the profit she earns goes on their family expenses. Therefore she has applied for a Youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy more clothes to meet the demand of her clients. 

She looks forward to expanding her business by selling perfumes, incenses, accessories and more clothes in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Katrina Marie

texts.en: Katrina has been teaching in a private school for a living. She just graduated last year and has started to work recently. After passing a licensure examination, she is now eager to apply to a government school to earn more money to support her four siblings. Her parents earn from farming and to send all of them to school is not very easy. But her income now is just for living expenses and she can't afford more expenditures. She is now a licensed teacher and in order to take documents for application processes and other purposes, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit. She hopes to become successful someday.

loans.use: to pay for documents for application processes

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Mwanakombo operates various businesses such as a cosmetics shop, and she sells clothes and charcoal. She would like to apply for a new loan of KES 100,000 to purchase bales of clothes, sacks of charcoal, braids, weaves and body lotion for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, sacks of charcoal, braids, weaves and body lotion for her business

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 25 years old, and she is married with two children.

She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, bananas and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used as savings to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, bananas and maize to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 45 years old and married to Mercy. They are blessed with three children. 

He has been in business for two years, and his monthly income is 28,000 Kenyan Shillings. He will use this loan to run his business. He will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses for renting. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

His hopes and dreams for his family and the business in the future are to live a prosperous life and to expand the business.

loans.use: to receive and transfer money

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 34 years old and married to Simon, and together they are blessed with two children who are in school.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha which she has been running for two years. She has applied for a first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy stock such as flasks and basins, among other items. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and save.

In the near future, she hopes to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy flasks, basins and other items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Marites supports her husband in cultivating their farm land by planting vegetables and root crops to sell. She is 45 years old and has only one child.

As they were not earning enough money, they decided to expand their plantation in order to increase production. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in vegetable and root crop production. 

Through patience and hard work, they believe that they will improve their farming business and increase their production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in vegetable and root crop production

loans.name: Kiriama

texts.en:
Kiriama is 28 years old, married and supports a family of five. He has been running a retail shop for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 32,000. 

With a loan of KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya, he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products like flour, toothpaste, sugar, rice, sodas, etc.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into his business for expansion. His dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to restock his retail shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 34 years old, is a single mother. She is supporting three children who are in school.

She is in the business of selling fruits in Naivasha, which she has been running for three years. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya after repaying her previous loan on time. The loan will enable her to buy more stock of mangoes, tomatoes and potatoes for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business and pay the loan amount.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, tomatoes and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a single parent and entrepreneur with an only child.

She operates a general store to make a living. After five years running the business, she earns well enough to support the needs of her child and to be able to sustain the business.  

She has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 38-year-old gentleman from Kakamega County, married to Everlyne and the two have three children.

He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for two years earning an average income of KES 3,000 per month. He is taking his 3rd loan of KES 80,000 with VisionFund Kenya to buy livestock supplies in bulk. The profits will be used to repay the loan and add some savings.

His dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is still happily married and her children are doing well in school. She is still running her grocery business in Naivasha which she has been running for three years and has applied for a second loan from VisionFund Kenya after paying her previous loan on time to enable her buy stock of potatoes, mangoes, and cabbages among other things. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business and pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and improve her family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase stock such as bananas, potatoes, mangoes, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Editha has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fish, seasoning, spices, noodles, meat, etc. for her food-vending business.

She has been in this business for eight years. Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fish, seasoning, spices, noodles, meat, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres con Esperanza La señora Lidia Verónica, se dedica a la venta de oro y plata desde hace 26 años y es vendedora ambulante, nuevamente se ve en la necesidad de hacer un préstamo.  Los pedidos de plata han crecido mucho y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso necesita del préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes que confían en ella.  Su hija quien le ayuda a vender la apoya en todo y por eso la mercadería que tienen como argollas, pulseras, anillos, cadenas, dijes todos en plata no le alcanza.  Tiene un poco de pedido de oro pero también debe comprar más piezas para no fallarles a sus clientes.esta muy agradecida por la ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres con Esperanza" duo

Lidia Verónica has been making a living selling gold and silver for 26 years. She works as a street vendor and has seen a new need to take out a loan. Orders for silver have increased a lot and Lidia does not have the money to buy everything that she needs. She therefore needs the loan in order not to disappoint her customers, who trust in her. Lidia's daughter helps her to sell, and supports her with everything. Lidia and her daughter sell rings, bracelets, chains and lockets. Lidia does not have enough to buy all of these items in silver. Lidia has a few orders for gold products but she must also buy more so as not to fail her customers. Lidia is very grateful for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver materials to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 64 años de edad y toda su vida ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida. ÉL habita en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos y para él lo más importante se centra en el bienestar de su familia. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios (arena, cemento y grava) para encementar el piso de la vivienda y así poder proceder a la mejora del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and has fought to help his family get ahead and provide them with better living conditions all his life. José lives in a house that he owns with his wife and children. For José, his family's well-being is the most important thing in his life.

In order to improve his and his family's living conditions, José is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to invest in buying necessary materials (sand, cement and gravel) to cement the floor of his home. With this loan he can proceed to improve the floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and gravel in order to cement the floor in his home.

loans.name: Anner Antonio

texts.es: Anner tiene 21 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Managua. Soltero, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su meta próxima es encontrar un trabajo donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá terminar el curso y así obtener un buen empleo. Su plan futuro es estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Química.
texts.en:
Anner is 21 years old and originally from the city of Managua. Anner is single and studying at one of the city's universities. Anner's next goal is to find a job where he can apply the knowledge that he has learned. 

Anner is applying for this loan in order to pay for his degree title course. He believes that this loan will be of great help to him as he will be able to finish his course and find a good job. Anner's plan for the future is to study chemical engineering.
.

loans.use: to pay for his degree title course.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Catarina es una persona de  59 años, vive en el municipio de Nahuala, Sololá, la familia la conforma un hijo y una hija ya mayores de edad, ella tiene un molino de  nixtamal y una tienda, la ayuda su esposo a atenderlo, ella necesita Q. 6,000.00 para comprar más productos para su tienda e invertirlo en el molino y así darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Catarina es una persona muy emprendedora y ayuda a su familia con los ingresos, el deseo de ella en futuro es comprar un molino más grande.
texts.en: Catarina is 59 years old and lives in Nahuala, in the Sololá department. Her family consists of one son and one daughter, both of whom are now adults. Catarina has a boiled maize grinder and a shop, where her husband helps her. Catarina needs a loan of 6,000 Qetzal in order to buy more products for her store, to invest in the grinder and to offer her customers better service. Catarina is a very enterprising person and helps her family with an income. Her future wish is to buy a larger grinder.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado de educacion básica, está soltero y tiene dos hijos pero no viven con él, ellos ya tienen su propio hogar ya que están acompañados, solamente vive con su madre  quien depende de él. 

Pedro tiene ganado de doble propósito, tiene alrededor de 6 años en esto, además, es empleado en una carpinteria, el trabajo está a un kilómetro de distancia desde du casa y viaja en bicicleta, a parte de eso tiene ganado el cual es un ingreso extra. 


El crédito que él está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar un ternero, pues aparte de ser empleado él tiene ganado, la necesidad satisfecha es que puede comprar de una vez, y le cuesta menos tiempo. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, tanto en la carpinteria como con ganado, asi también espera que su mamá lo apoye más y el préstamo le ayudará porque tendrá un patrimonio extra.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old and completed up to fifth grade at school. He is single. Pedro has two children but they now have their own partners and households. Pedro lives only with the mother of his children, who depends on him.

Pedro owns dual purpose cattle. He has been in this work for six years and also works at a carpentry workshop. The workshop is a kilometre from his house and he arrives there by bicycle. He also has the cattle in order to raise an extra income.

Pedro needs this loan in order to buy a calf. With a loan he can buy the cow quickly and save some time.

Pedro's dreams are to continue working, both in carpentry and with the cattle. He also hopes that his mother can support him more and that this loan will help him to leave a greater inheritance.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Dúo Genesis Patzicia Group

texts.es: Dúo Genesis Patzicia este grupo esta conformado por la señora Olga Marina de 47 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de granos basicos, ella vende arroz frijol maiz, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta ya que su nahelo es agrandar mas su negocio y tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: The “Genesis Patzicia” group includes Olga Marina.  She is 47 years old and sells basic grain products;  rice, beans, and corn and has been doing this for several years.  She is asking for this loan to buy more products to sell.  She wants to add to her business and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Lilian Jacoba

texts.es:
La joven Lilian es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 10 años.
Lilian tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive, necesita el préstamo para la compra como arroz, frijoles, café, leche, pan, manteca, pan, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Lilian con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta ayuda poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Lilian espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del  2014
texts.en:
Lilian is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a southern Honduras community.  She has had a general store for 10 years.

Lilian has her business in her home and needs this loan to buy rice, beans, coffee, milk, bread, lard, etc. so she can work which provides her a great part of her income. 
Lilian expects her sales to increase with the help of this loan and this will be very helpful to her, since she doesn’t have the products she needs to meet her daily customer requests.  The increased income will help her improve her family’s quality of life.

Lilian expects to grow her business in the short run and be able to continue supporting her family and for her children to have the necessary education so they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2014

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 36, is married to Esther. Together, they are blessed with one child and support four people.

Stephen has a retail shop in Naivasha, which he has been running for eight years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy stock such as flour, rice and sugar. With the anticipated profits, he plans to improve his family's living standards.

In the near future, he hopes to open a bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. In her life, she says, she has very few reasons to be happy, since she is a widow, and nature did not give her a chance to have a baby and become a mother. 

Her only interest in life now is her business, which she had established with her husband when he was alive. She has a small food market, where she also makes fast food and serves coffee and tea. 

Her market's location is more than convenient, since it is near Yerevan State University of Ijevan Branch, and her main customers are students. They are used to Lyudmila’s food and like her market very much. 

As she says, students visit her market because prices are cheap, service is fast and the surroundings are cute and clean. Her business income is not bad, since she is both able to take care of herself and also help her relatives financially.

Lyudmila needs a loan, which will greatly help her buy new tables and chairs for her food market and enlarge her market’s assortment.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food market and enlarge her market’s assortment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used-bags to add to her current stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 73 years old, widowed, and a mother of one. She has run a retail shop for the last sixteen years earning a monthly income of KES 29,000.  With a loan of KES 60,000 from VisonFund Kenya, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hastings

texts.en: Hastings is a 41-year-old man from Kakamega region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married, and supports nine people in his family.  He has a retail shop, which has been operating for the last six years, and makes a monthly income of Kes 10,000.  He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stocks like rice flour, sugar, tealeaves and more chairs. He will use the anticipated profits to start a new business. His dream is to start a new business and support his family.

loans.use: to add more stocks for his retail shop.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 45 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Danson and they are blessed with four children aged 20, 18, 10 and 3 years.

Rahab is a farmer, a business that she has been doing for eight years earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She applied her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers. 

She plans to use the profits to repay her loan, educate her children and expand her farming business. She hopes to improve her living standards by earning more through her expansive farming activity.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily has been helping her husband to operate their own farm to make a living. She also had a retail store. With her income from farming, she successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farm inputs. 

To expand the farm, Lily took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover land preparation costs for the next cropping. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover land preparation costs in preparation for the next cropping

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school. He is from Naivasha. For the past four years, George has been a milk vendor. 

George is requesting a loan to buy more milk for his business. This will be his third loan from Vision Fund Kenya. He will use the profit from his loan to expand his business. In the near future, George hopes to continue to expand.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is married and has six school-going children. For the past six years, she has operated a business selling poultry. Kibibi sells to neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of business. Kibibi owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

Kibibi is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years old and married with three children who are between one and seven years old. For many years, he has been running a hawking business selling jackets.

David is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more jackets to add to his stock. This will be his second loan. David will use the profits from his loan to support his family and repay the loan. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy jackets to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 45 years old and is married with four children who are in school. He is from Nyandarua South. Richard has been a farmer for many years. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer. This will be his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. Richard will use the profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to expand his farm and uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 49 years old, from Nyahururu. He is married to Julia, and they are blessed with three children, 22, 18 and 12 years old. Peter is a farmer, a business he has been in for eight years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his first loan, of KES 50,000, from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers. he plans to use the profits to repay his loan, educate his children and expand his farming business. He hopes to improve his living standards by earning more through his expanded farming activity.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 34 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to John and they are blessed with two children aged 16 and 8 years old.

She operates a grocery business, which she has been doing for twelve years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She has applied for her third loan of 22,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use her loan to expand her grocery by adding more stock of vegetables and potatoes.

She anticipates using the gains from her business to repay her loan, educate her children and expand her business. In future she hopes to buy a plot and build houses for rent.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business by adding more stock of vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Yerem

texts.en:
Yerem lives in the village Debed in the Lori region. Yerem works at the private company as a stonecutter, but since this work is seasonal, his main source of income for his family is from farming. On his farm Yerem has a cow, a calf, a piglet, a horse and ten chickens. 

Yerem is a father of three children and he also takes care of his retired parents. So he does his best to earn much money for his big family’s living. His wife helps him in the sale of farm products such as milk, cheese, butter, meat and eggs to their already loyal customers. 

On his plot of land, Yerem mainly cultivates wheat and beans. Having a big family means also to have a lot of problems of its living conditions and Yerem thinks that if he can make his farm richer with more income, it is real. Therefore, he asks a loan which he will use for the purchase of two more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows for his farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with four children aged 18,16,10 and 10 years old.

Virginia owns and operates a cereal shop in Nyahururu, she has been in the business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the funds  acquired to boost her cereal business.

She anticipates using the gains from her business to pay her loan, educate her children and expand her business as well. In the future she hopes to have more cereal shops in different parts of the country.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Yoribek

texts.en: Yoribek is 46 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife and four children. Some of his children are schoolboys. Yoribek works hard to earn a living and to pay for the education of his children. He began his animal husbandry business 10 years ago. The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry. His wife helps him manage the business. They feed cows. Their income is small, hardly enough to provide food for the family. He wants to develop his business, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of his cattle and improve the  family's living conditions with the profits. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 36 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to Samuel, and they are blessed with three children, 16, 10 and 3 years old. Zipporah is a farmer, a business she has been engaged in for eight years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her first loan, of KES 30,000, from VisionFund Kenya, to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to use the profits to repay her loan, educate her children and expand her farming business. She hopes to improve her living standards by earning more through her expanded farming activity.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en: Ludy helps her husband operate a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. During their two years of running the service, she has earned well for the family. Her first loan, used to buy tires, was successfully repaid with the revenue that was generated. To improve their service, she took out a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy vehicle accessories. She is happy that she has saved her earnings for the education of her children and to purchase one more motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories to improve service.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They have one child who is one year old.

Daniel has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers. Daniel will use the profits made to repay his loan.

He hopes to borrow more in the future so as to start other new farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 27 years old and married with two children.

Emelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Emelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Emelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.en: Pierrine is 39 years old. She is a mother of five children aged between 8 and 16. Pierrine is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, foo-foo, and other foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Bayandur

texts.en:
Bayandur has been married for 16 years. He is 48 years old and has two children. One of them is a 14-year-old son who is in the seventh class at school, and the other is an 11-year-old daughter who is in the fourth class. Bayandur’s wife is a housewife. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, and now they are living in Aybasanli village in the Fuzuli region. 

Bayandur has a “chayxana”, which translates into English as 'teahouse'. Here Bayandur serves “samovar tea” to his customers. Today he needs a loan to the amount of 1,750 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the roof of the “chayxana”. 

Bayandur is very grateful to the Kiva organization for their help. In the future he wants to increase the size of the “chayxana” and his monthly income.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his “chayxana” (teahouse)

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 27 years old. He is single and has owned a bar for the past year. He has requested a loan to buy more beers and soft drinks, such as sodas and mineral waters, to sell. He plans to reinvest his profits back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers to sell

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is 38 years old. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Nargiza has a college education, and she works as a teacher in a local school. Nargiza has been working for more than 21 years. She teaches the young classes. With her extensive experience, she is one of the best teachers. 

Nargiza is also a caring mother of 3 children who always seeks to improve the well-being of her family. Nargiza wants to buy furniture for her household, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with no children and she has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

Sarah sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis working six days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling both used and first hand clothes and also to sell on a wholesale basis. Her major expenses include food, rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy a bale  of used clothes.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca wants to thank the Kiva lenders for the support they extended her last cycle. Her pharmacy really did well using the loan, as you can see in the photos. Prisca works 7 days a week and 13 hours per day. She supports her pharmacy and supplements shop with her income from her Boda boda business (motor cycles).
She started this business so that she could earn a living. She says she sells her goods to local people from around Kyotera town. She has acquired this loan in order to boost her business and educate her children. Prisca started her business in 2007 and her future dreams are to educate all her children and to enlarger her business to the level of whole selling.
She faces the challenge of a lack of capital for the business.
She describes her self as an honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 64 years old, married, and has five children. 

Lilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Lilia has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married and has one child, who is currently in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Salima has operated a fish-selling business for the last twenty years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the requested loan of KES 30,000, Salima wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu in order to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widowed woman with six children, one of whom is in school while the rest are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a food-making business, making comestibles like beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. 

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and to establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en: Arevik lives in Ijevan City in the Tavush region. Arevik is 46 years old and since a very young age, she has been engaged in farming; first with her parents and now with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a very skilled farmer, but from time to time, he goes to the Russian Federation in order to earn more money and stays there for five or six months. During this period, Arevik’s sons greatly helps her in farming and agricultural activities. In her farm, Arevik is mainly involved in swine breeding and poultry (5 piglets and 30 chickens). They also cultivate a plot of land, the harvest of which is mainly used for their family. They only sell milk and eggs from their farm. Arevik wants to become more skilled in swine breeding as well as being able to sell more meat than now. She is asking a loan to purchase animal fodder for her piglets, in order to keep them well fed and prepared for sale.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for her piglets in order to keep them well fed and prepared for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married and has four children, two of whom go to school.  They live in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major expenses include school fees, rent and medication. 

For the past two years, Grace has been selling vegetables and fruits at the market seven days a week. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, cassava and pineapples.  

Grace's goals are to educate her children to university level and sell on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, cassava and pineapples.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of drinks and biscuits

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура молодая 25-летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем, имеет двух маленьких детей. С ними также живут ее свекор и свекровь. Муж Манзуры водитель. Он каждый день с раннего утра до поздней вечери работает по маршрутной линии города, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Манзура тоже не отстает от мужа в зарабатывании. Она по профессии портниха. Три года назад она начала свое швейное дело у себя дома. Манзура шьет национальные женские платья. Ее услуга всегда имеет спрос, так как женщины и девушки в Таджикистане предпочитают шить на заказ платья национального стиля. Сейчас Манзура хочет расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США, чтобы купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. Благодаря новой машинке, она сможет брать больше заказов и доходность ее деятельности увеличится.
texts.en: Manzura is a young 25-year-old resident of Tursun-zoda city. She is married and has two young children. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law live with her. Manzura's husband is a driver. Everyday from early in the morning until late at night, he works on the public shuttle lines of the city in order to earn a living. Mansura keeps up with her husband by earning money as well. She is a seamstress by trade. Three years ago, she started her own sewing business in her home. Mazura sews Tajik women's dresses. Her services are always in demand as women and girls in Tajikistan prefer to have their Tajik-style dresses handmade. Now Manzura wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD in order to buy a modernized, computerized sewing machine. Thanks to the new sewing machine, she will be able to take more orders and increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Pelesia

texts.en:
Pelesia  appreciates  her previous loan which enabled her to enhance the profits from her fish-selling business. She is now requesting a new loan of ksh.100,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Pelesia appreciates the financial support offered by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена торгует на крупном местном рынке города Мелитополь. Она занимается продажей детской одежды и обуви. Торговое место у нее собственное, работает в сфере торговли на рынке уже 14 лет. 
Сумму в 15 000 гривен Елена планирует вложить в приобретение товара к весеннему сезону, а именно закупить платья, кофты, блузы, головные уборы и легкие куртки на весну под реализацию. За счет полученной прибыли надеется развивать свой бизнес и дальше и обеспечивать 7-летнюю дочь, которую воспитывает сама.
texts.en:
Yelena sells merchandise in the large local market in the city of Melitopol. She sells children's clothing and shoes. She has her own stall and has worked in market sales for the last 14 years.

Yelena plans to invest the amount of 15,000 hryvnia into purchasing merchandise for the spring season, specifically dresses, jackets, blouses, hats and light coats to sell in the spring. With the received profits, she hopes to expand her business and provide for her seven-year-old daughter, who she is raising alone.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, blouses, jackets and hats for the spring season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (old parents).

She operates a beauty salon from home and works seven days a week. She also offers her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She earns additional income from selling fire wood from home. 

Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX to buy hair treatments, shampoo, braids, weaves and relaxers. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goal and aspirations are to get more capital so as to buy another hair dryer and fridge, so she can serve her customers better. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her main expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more hair treatments, shampoo, braids, weaves and relaxers

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is thirty years old. He lives in a village called Yenokavan in the Tavush region. He is the father of three children, two daughters and a son. Gurgen has only ever worked in farming. He has a big farm and dreams of making it bigger. In his farm he has thirty goats, ten chickens, two geese and his own plot of land on which he established an orchard with a number of fruit trees. On his plot of land he also cultivates wheat and corn. He also gathers hay from his land for his farm animals. Gurgen has a decent income from the sale of goat milk, from which Armenian people make very tasty cheese. He also sells the vegetables he grows on his farm, including potatoes, beans, cucumbers and tomatoes. All the farming skills Gurgen inherited from his parents. He is very satisfied with his farming and his life in the village.
 
Gurgen has decided to increase the number of goats he has and also wants to buy fodder to feed them, as the amount of fodder he currently has will not be enough with a larger herd.

loans.use: increase the number of goats he has and buy fodder for them

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марианна — из Хуста, Западная Украина. Она занимается торговлей одеждой и обувью. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет. Место под магазин арендует. Для открытия своего дела в свое время Марианна вложила собстенные сбережения. В ведении бизнеса ей активно помогают родители и муж.
Марианне нужна дополнительная сумма в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести весеннюю женскую одежду.  Постепенно развивая свой бизнес, она надеется скопить денег, которые потом сможет потратить на укрепление бизнеса и в будущем — на образование своих трех детей.
texts.en:
Maryana is from Khoost, Western Ukraine. She sells clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years already. She rents the space under a store. In order to open her business on time, she invested her own savings into it. Her parents and husband actively help her run her business.

Maryana needs an additional 8,000 UAH in order to purchase a Spring collection of women's clothing. Developing her business little by little, she hopes to save money which she can then spend on strengthening her business and on the future education of her three children.

loans.use: to buy a new selection of Spring clothing.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a widowed woman. She is 60 years old. She has 5 adult children. Dilorom has received medical education. She has worked more than 40 years in a local hospital, where she is a nurse. Dilorom does her job well and has a great deal of experience. She brought up her children alone as her husband died at a very young age. She is a very kind woman. Dilorom wants to repair her house as her house is in bad condition. Dilorom is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood and etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and four of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents and she also offers her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She has no additional sources of income. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX to buy hair treatments, shampoo, hair oils, braids, weaves and relaxers. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goal is to get more capital so she can buy another hair dryer and rollers, so she can serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her main expenses are food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, shampoo, hair oils, braids, weaves and relaxers

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 23-year-old pregnant woman, from Kutaisi city. She lives with her husband, who works in the military and monthly gets a 250 GEL fixed salary. It's clear that only this income is really hardly enough to pay all daily costs and satisfy the family's increased needs. After the birth of a child they will have many more concerns and no financial support. Because of this Lana has made a plan to develop a trading business. 

Lana couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start-Up program began, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program gives people, like Lana, a chance to start or re-start a business. Lana requested a loan of USD 700 to purchase products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. 

Thanks to the Start-Up program, Lana will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her child. This couple rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To start trading various home products and clothing.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old and married with nine children. With one child still in school, Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, juice, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, juice, biscuits, cereals, etc. 

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, juice, biscuits, cereals to sell.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is twenty-three years old and lives in Stepanavan city, in the Lori region. She lives with her parents. Narine graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Foreign Languages. Her mother is an accountant and her father has his own car sale business. Narine now works at the college as a teacher of English Language. This young lady is a very active person; she just graduated and already works. She also has several pupils to whom she gives paid private courses in English Language, to prepare them for entrance examinations.

Narine greatly wants to buy a computer and this is the reason she is asking for a loan. A computer will help her to make her lessons and courses more informative due to modern methods of teaching.

loans.use: to make her lessons and courses more informative due to modern methods of teaching

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en:
Antiqa is 57 years old and is an IDP (internally displaced person). She is married and has two daughters and two sons. Her husband earns money for the family working as a laborer. The whole family lives in an IDP settlement. Antiqa has been working as a farmer for 34 years. She raises fruits (pears, apples, cherries and apricots) and vegetables (greens, green onions, cucumbers, potatoes and etc.) and then sells them at a local bazaar. 

Azerbaijan cuisine is very rich and various. People prepare different national dishes from vegetables with meat. The cook basdirma, bughlama, doghramajh, dovgha and etc. They also like fresh fruits for dessert or prepare different fruit pie, cakes and kinds of juice for holidays, parties and ordinary life.

Though Antiqa is old she is still very hardworking woman. She loves her job and wants to expand it. She applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to get a supply of new fertilizers and build a small green house for her garden. She knows that this will protect her harvest and increase her income.

loans.use: to get a supply of new fertilizers and build a small green house.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru: Сергей работает грузчиком на оптовой овощной базе. Он живет в частном доме вместе со своими отцом, мамой, и сестрой. Все работают и на работе и дома в огороде. Сергей уже давно мечтал сделать ремонт в кухне. Благодаря КИВА кредиту это становится возможным. Он просит предоставить кредит в размере 8,000 гривен. После кухни Сергей планирует взяться за ремонт ванной комнаты, т.о. образом улучшить жилищные условия свои и своей семьи.
texts.en: Sergei works as a freight loader at a wholesale vegetable depot. He lives in a single family home with his father, mother and sister. They all work both at jobs and at home in their vegetable garden. Sergei has dreamed of repairing his kitchen for a long time now. Thanks to his KIVA loan, this is becoming a possibility. He is requesting a loan for 8,000 UAH. After the kitchen, Sergei plans tackle repairing the bathroom, thus improving his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

Mwanamisi sells coconuts next to the preparatory school.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with two children who go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, beans, which she then sells to her neighbors and passersby. She has mentioned that seasonality as her major challenge. With the Kshs 20000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil and charcoal for her business
